* The Digital Product Area Manager is crucial for developing our business, and we believe that your presence with the team and working the majority of the time in the workplace is important.
 **More Information*** This role is full time (40hours per week) and based in Älmhult, Sweden. This role sits in Range Operations and reports to the Digital Manager If you have any questions about the role, please connect with the Recruitment Partner Monaka Perumal at Monaka.perumal@inter.ikea.com
* Interested? Send us your CV, in English, by 12th May 2025.
* At IKEA, we are looking for people who believe everyone deserves a seat at the table. You’re welcome no matter where you come from, what you believe, and what you look like. We don’t even care how you have furnished your home. We’re interested in you simply because you’re you. Even if your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. We believe that people’s different perspectives, backgrounds, and personalities make us better at understanding our customers dreams and needs. At IKEA, we’re all on the same project.  

  

If you have a special need that requires accommodation in the recruitment process, just let us know.
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: Universitetsadjunkt i Systemutveckling
description:
Högskolan Väst drivs av att göra skillnad. Genom vår utbildning och forskning vill vi bidra till innovation, en positiv samhällsutveckling och en hållbar värld. Vi är en modern högskola under stark utveckling. Vår profil arbetsintegrerat lärande (AIL) är en del av allt vi gör och att samverka med omvärlden är prioriterat för oss. Högskolan Väst har ett av landets högsta söktryck och en hög andel av studenterna etablerar sig på arbetsmarknaden. Högskolan har 13 000 studenter och över 700 anställda. Vårt attraktiva campus ligger centralt i Trollhättan och är en plats där kunskaper, idéer, kulturer och människor möts. Vi jobbar aktivt för en inkluderande arbetsmiljö med jämställda förhållanden och sätter värde på de kvaliteter som mångfald tillför verksamheten. Vi som arbetar på Högskolan Väst gör skillnad varje dag. Vill du också det?

**Högskolan Väst söker universitetsadjunkt i****Systemutveckling med Fokus på Programmering och Webbutveckling**
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Vi söker en engagerad, pedagogisk och kunnig adjunkt i systemutveckling med fokus på programmering och webbutveckling. Som adjunkt hos oss kommer du att spela en viktig roll i att utbilda, handleda och examinera våra studenter inom olika områden av systemutveckling och webbutveckling.

### **Arbetsuppgifter:**


Du kommer att undervisa i programmering, med särskilt fokus på C#, både på grundläggande och avancerad nivå. Du kommer även att utveckla webbapplikationer som innefattar både front-end och back-end-teknik.


Du kommer hålla i föreläsningar, handleda studenter, rätta inlämningsuppgifter, framställa kursmaterial och bidra till förbättringsarbetet kring kurser och programmet.

### **Behörighetskrav för anställning som universitetsadjunkt:**

* **Visad pedagogisk skicklighet.** Sökande som saknar pedagogiska meriter från  

en akademisk miljö ska ha kompetens likvärdig med högskolans  

behörighetskrav, dock kan den ha uppnåtts på annat sätt än inom den  

akademiska miljön.
* **Genomgången högskolepedagogisk utbildning om minst tio veckor eller**  

**motsvarande kompetens.** Om högskolepedagogisk utbildning saknas kan  

anställning ändå ske under förutsättning att den anställde genomför  

utbildningen under anställningens två första år.
* **Avlagd examen på avancerad nivå eller motsvarande.** I vissa fall kan  

yrkesskicklighet vara behörighetsgivande i stället för examen på avancerad  

nivå. För att detta ska vara aktuellt ska det röra sig om yrkesskicklighet som  

bedöms motsvara en examen på avancerad nivå och har relevans för de  

arbetsuppgifter som ska ingå i anställningen.

### **För denna anställning krävs dessutom:**

* God samarbetsförmåga.
* Goda kunskaper i objektorienterad programmering
* Erfarenhet med C# och .NET för webbutveckling.
* Erfarenhet av SQL-databaser
* Behärska HTML, CSS och Javascript
* Kommunicera på svenska och engelska
* Relevant universitets- eller högskoleutbildning inom informatik, datavetenskap eller motsvarande.

### **Meriterande för anställningen är:**

* Tidigare erfarenhet av undervisning och mentorskap
* Erfarenhet av Javscriptramverk som React, Vue eller Anguar
* Erfarenhet av andra programmeringsspråk som PHP, Java och Kotlin
* Erfarenhet av molnplattformar som Microsoft Azure och Amazon Web Services
* Utveckling av mobila applikationer med Android Studio eller React Native
* Kunskap kring UX och grafisk design
* Versionshantering med Git
* Kännedom om Generativ AIs möjligheter och begränsningar
* Kunskap kring serveradministration i Linux, nätverk och virtuella miljöer
* Kunskap och erfarenhet inom IT-säkerhet

**Bedömningsgrunder:**
----------------------


Vid Högskolan Väst finns följande generella bedömningsgrunder.

* *Pedagogisk skicklighet*
* *Vetenskaplig skicklighet*
* *Samverkansskicklighet*
* *Administrativ skicklighet*
* *Ledningsskicklighet*
* *Annan yrkesskicklighet*

  

Vid bedömning kommer pedagogisk skicklighet sättas i första hand, och vetenskaplig skicklighet sättas i andra hand. *Samverkansskicklighet, a**dministrativ skicklighet och l**edningsskicklighet sätts i tredje hand.*


Vid bedömningen av skicklighet beaktas anställningens ämnesområde, ämnesbeskrivning och arbetsuppgifter.

**Övrigt:**
-----------


Anställningen är en visstidsanställning.  

  

I urvalsprocessen kan det bli aktuellt med provföreläsningar, arbetsprov, intervjuer och referenstagning.  

  

Ansökan görs digitalt via vårt rekryteringsverktyg. Du som sökande ansvarar för att ansökan är komplett i enlighet med annonsen och att den är högskolan tillhanda senast sista ansökningsdag. De underlag som inte kan skickas digitalt, exempelvis böcker och publikationer, ska märkas med referensnummer R 2025/73 och skickas i ett exemplar. För information kring utformning av ansökan, se *Anvisning för utformning av ansökan* som du hittar här Högskolan Väst - Arbeta hos oss (hv.se).  

  

**Ansökan ställs till:**  

Högskolan Väst  

HR  

461 86 Trollhättan  

  

Sista ansökningsdag är **2025-05-19**  

  

Vi undanber oss all direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av rekryteringsannonser.


Anställningsform: särskild visstidsanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Trollhättan | Län: Västra Götalands län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/73 | Kontakt: Livia Norström(avdelningschef) 0732681940, | Facklig företrädare: Magnus Andersson, OFR 0520-223193, Tobias Arvemo, SACO-S +46520-223505, | Publicerat: 2025-04-28 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-05-19

title: Staff Product Designer
description:
Natural Cycles is a leading women’s health company that developed the world’s first birth control app, used by millions globally. We are a fast growing startup, and we promote an international working environment filled with smart and ambitious colleagues based in Stockholm, Geneva, New York, and remotely. Our mission is to pioneer women’s health through research and passion, empowering every woman with the knowledge she needs to take charge of her health.
  
We’re seeking an experienced Staff Product Designer to spearhead the creation of our app's innovative AI assistant and reimagine its core educational and customer support features. You’ll define how our users learn about women’s health and their own bodies. You’ll have significant design ownership across a broad surface area, shaping core experiences that directly impact user engagement, trust, and retention.
  
By joining our team, you’ll get the opportunity to collaborate on a variety of projects with a team of top product designers, product managers, and engineers in a fast-paced, rapidly growing, environment.
  
Please note that we are hiring for this role in Sweden.
  
You have…
  
  

Strong UX skills with experience working on complex user flows. Experience with service design is a plus.
  
  

Strong UI skills to develop new educational features for our app’s knowledge hub. You have the ability to make learning about women’s health interactive and engaging.
  
  

Experience using quantitative data and user research to inform your design decisions. You may even have lead interviews or analysed data yourself (not only will you collaborate with user researchers and data analysts, you’ll design features to collect user feedback and scientific research data.)
  
  

A strong portfolio demonstrating similar past work.
  
  

You are…
  
  

Interested in AI and chatbot design
  
  

Able to work independently and comfortable owning projects from start to pixel-perfect finish. You thrive in an environment that fosters autonomy and trust.
  
  

A strong communicator with excellent presentation skills. You’re comfortable receiving constructive feedback and working closely with developers.
  
  

What we offer
  
  

Flexible work arrangement - you will be part of a team based in and around Stockholm that values effective collaboration and transparent communication, irrespective of work location
  
  

Professional development - you will collaborate with industry leading developers, promoting continuous growth and skill enhancement
  
  

Modern technology - you will leverage innovative technologies and tools, within an environment that empowers you to contribute ideas and take ownership of your work
  
  

Impactful projects - you will contribute to groundbreaking projects that redefine industry standards and create tangible value
  
  

Commitment to quality - you will join a dynamic and progressive organization that prioritizes profitable, long-term product development
  
  

Location
  
We are remote-friendly, but we find great value in being able to connect with our teams in person. Most of the product development team you will work with is located in Stockholm.
  
Sounds interesting?
  
If you want to be part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position as soon as possible. Please include your portfolio in your application.
  
We look forward to hearing from you!
  
How to apply
  
To apply, just upload your CV and portfolio, then answer the questions on the application form. Keep in mind that we can't accept applications through email because of GDPR, and only applications submitted via the career site (and in English) will be considered.
  
At Natural Cycles we value diversity and inclusion because we know that teams with people from different backgrounds and experiences are stronger. We welcome candidates from all walks of life and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.
  
  

**Note:** We are not looking for consultants or help from recruitment agencies

title: Erfaren UX/UI till Sesol
description:
Är du en erfaren UX/UI-designer som vill göra verklig skillnad?
  
Vill du vara med och forma användarupplevelsen i ett företag som driver den gröna omställningen framåt? På [företagsnamn] söker vi nu en Senior UX/UI Designer som vill bidra till att utveckla våra interna digitala verktyg och plattformar – och samtidigt vara en del av Sveriges solenergi-revolution.
  
I den här rollen får du möjlighet att påverka både produktstrategi och designbeslut på riktigt. Du blir en nyckelperson i vårt digitala produktteam och arbetar nära såväl utvecklare som affärssidan. Genom din erfarenhet av research, UX-metodik och design av komplexa system kommer du vara med och skapa lösningar som förbättrar våra interna processer och stärker vår affär.
  
Vi letar efter dig som brinner för användarcentrerad design och som vill vara en del av ett företag där hållbarhet, innovation och samarbete står i centrum.
  
**Rollbeskrivning:** UX/UI Designer
  
**Om rollen:** Vi söker en Senior UX/UI Designer med minst 5 års erfarenhet till vårt digitala produktteam. I den här rollen kommer du att leda designarbetet för användarcentrerade lösningar inom våra enterprise-plattformar, i nära samarbete med både intressenter och utvecklingsteamet över hela organisationen. Tjänsten kombinerar djup UX-research, datadriven analys och strategiskt produktdesignarbete för att förbättra arbetsflöden för våra interna team och stärka affärsresultaten.
  
  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter:**  

Leda hela UX-designprocessen – från research och idéarbete till prototyper och slutlig designleverans.
  
Samarbeta med intressenter för att förstå affärsmål, användarbehov och tekniska förutsättningar.
  
Skapa wireframes, användarflöden, prototyper och detaljerade UI-designer för att effektivt kommunicera designkoncept.
  
Definiera och implementera designstrategier som ökar effektivitet, användbarhet och användarnöjdhet i interna produkter.
  
Facilitera workshops tillsammans med tvärfunktionella team för att samskapa lösningar.
  
Underhålla och vidareutveckla ett skalbart designsystem för att säkerställa konsekvens och enhetlighet över alla interna plattformar.
  
Stödja produktroadmapen med användarcentrerade insikter och bidra till prioritering av funktioner samt den långsiktiga produktvisionen, inklusive identifiering av förbättringsområden i interna plattformar (CRM, övervakningsverktyg, dashboards).
  
Genomföra användartester och analysera både kvalitativa och kvantitativa data för att kontinuerligt förbättra lösningarna.
  
  

**Vi söker dig som har:**  

5+ års erfarenhet inom UX/UI-design, gärna med fokus på interna verktyg eller B2B-plattformar.
  
Dokumenterad erfarenhet av UX-research (intervjuer, enkäter, användartester) och datadriven analys som underlag för produktbeslut.
  
Stark erfarenhet av design för komplexa system (t.ex. dashboards, CRM-system eller operativa plattformar).
  
Goda kunskaper i Figma eller liknande designverktyg.
  
Erfarenhet av designsystem, tillgänglighetsstandarder och responsiv design.
  
Mycket god samarbetsförmåga och kommunikationsförmåga – du har lätt för att skapa samsyn både med tekniska team och affärssidan.
  
Flytande engelska (svenska är meriterande).
  
  

Varför arbeta hos oss?
  
Var med och bidra till Sveriges solenergi-revolution och den gröna omställningen.
  
Arbeta med projekt som har direkt påverkan på våra processer och affärseffektivitet.
  
Flexibla arbetsformer (hybridarbete).
  
Möjlighet att påverka produktens riktning och strategi.
  
  

**Bra att veta om anställningenLön:** Fast lön
  
**Placering:** Jönköping
  
**Tillträde:** Enligt överenskommelse
  
**Ansvarig rekryterare:** Anna Henebäck anna.heneback@sesol.se
  
Om Sesol
  
Vi älskar solen lite mer än andra - att jobba hos oss på Sesol innebär därför ett soligt äventyr som vi vill att du ska få uppleva. Tillsammans bidrar vi alla till att göra världen till en lite grönare plats. Med vårt huvudkontor i Jönköping och kontor i 17 andra städer i Sverige och Norge, är vi en arbetsgivare för alla som vill ta sig ut ur skuggorna och ut i solen. Med Nordic Capital som majoritetsägare och vårt dotterbolag Sesol Cyprus, så fortsätter vi vår tillväxtresa inom förnybar energi.
  
Välkommen till Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare!

title: Staff Product Designer
description:
*Natural Cycles° is a leading women’s health company that developed the world’s first birth control app, used by millions globally. We are a fast growing startup, and we promote an international working environment filled with smart and ambitious colleagues based in Stockholm, Geneva, New York, and remotely. Our mission is to pioneer women’s health through research and passion, empowering every woman with the knowledge she needs to take charge of her health.*


We’re seeking an experienced Staff Product Designer to spearhead the creation of our app's innovative AI assistant and reimagine its core educational and customer support features. You’ll define how our users learn about women’s health and their own bodies. You’ll have significant design ownership across a broad surface area, shaping core experiences that directly impact user engagement, trust, and retention.


By joining our team, you’ll get the opportunity to collaborate on a variety of projects with a team of top product designers, product managers, and engineers in a fast-paced, rapidly growing, environment.

**Please note that we are hiring for this role in Sweden.**

 **You have…**

* Strong UX skills with experience working on complex user flows. Experience with service design is a plus.
* Strong UI skills to develop new educational features for our app’s knowledge hub. You have the ability to make learning about women’s health interactive and engaging.
* Experience using quantitative data and user research to inform your design decisions. You may even have lead interviews or analysed data yourself (not only will you collaborate with user researchers and data analysts, you’ll design features to collect user feedback and scientific research data.)
* A strong portfolio demonstrating similar past work.

**You are…**

* Interested in AI and chatbot design
* Able to work independently and comfortable owning projects from start to pixel-perfect finish. You thrive in an environment that fosters autonomy and trust.
* A strong communicator with excellent presentation skills. You’re comfortable receiving constructive feedback and working closely with developers.

**What we offer**

* Flexible work arrangement - you will be part of a team based in and around Stockholm that values effective collaboration and transparent communication, irrespective of work location
* Professional development - you will collaborate with industry leading developers, promoting continuous growth and skill enhancement
* Modern technology - you will leverage innovative technologies and tools, within an environment that empowers you to contribute ideas and take ownership of your work
* Impactful projects - you will contribute to groundbreaking projects that redefine industry standards and create tangible value
* Commitment to quality - you will join a dynamic and progressive organization that prioritizes profitable, long-term product development

**Location**


We are remote-friendly, but we find great value in being able to connect with our teams in person. Most of the product development team you will work with is located in Stockholm.

 **Sounds interesting?**


If you want to be part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position as soon as possible. Please include your portfolio in your application.


We look forward to hearing from you!

 **How to apply**


To apply, just upload your CV and portfolio, then answer the questions on the application form. Keep in mind that we can't accept applications through email because of GDPR, and only applications submitted via the career site (and in English) will be considered.


At Natural Cycles we value diversity and inclusion because we know that teams with people from different backgrounds and experiences are stronger. We welcome candidates from all walks of life and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.

 **Note****: We are not looking for consultants or help from recruitment agencies**

title: Senior UX Researcher
description:
#### **About the Job**


As a Senior UX Researcher at Novacura, you will lead user research and usability engineering for a suite of products that enable professionals with limited to no programming skills to effortlessly create, launch, and manage web & mobile apps. Imagine a tool where you draw your apps and their behaviors without needing to code.

  

You'll play a vital role in bringing users, technology, business, and technologists together to create innovative solutions to user needs. You will ensure that our users are delighted by making sure that our products embody high levels of usability, utility and interaction design.

  

You'll collaborate with development teams engaged in web, iOS, and android app development, as well as web-based data visualization dashboards.


As a Senior UX Researcher at Novacura you will:


* Plan and lead user research studies and usability evaluations, identify and prioritize research needs between products and features
* Develop and maintain user groups
* Lead and mentor the UX group in UX research and usability engineering.
* Develop methods for user research and usability engineering as well as mentor designers in conducting usability tests and usability reviews.
* Lead process improvement to increase product UX performance and efficiency of development through a structured process for identifying, prioritizing and collecting user insight
* Participate in UX design development and provide feedback

#### **About You**


We are looking for a team-player who is communicative, accountable and driven. You take pride in ensuring that users are delighted by our products and continually seek improvement by evaluating the performance of features and user interfaces.


You’re a strategic thinker with a passion for understanding users and turning insights into action. You’ve spent years navigating complex product ecosystems and know how to ask the right questions, uncover hidden needs, and communicate findings that influence design, product, and business decisions.


You thrive in cross-functional teams and view research as a collaborative, ongoing conversation not a one-time report. You design mixed-methods studies, synthesize data, run workshops to align stakeholders and use visual means such as prototyping tools to express your vision and insight to influence product design.


You are curious about people, behavior, technology, and how all three come together in great product experiences.

  

We believe you have experience in the following areas:

  

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in human computer interaction, interaction design or a related field
* 4+ years of relevant experience in UX Research, usability engineering, UX concept development or similar
* Experience in driving one’s own work and mentoring design professionals
* User centered design methods, qualitative and quantitative research and usability evaluation
* Digital user interface design
* Figma or other prototyping experience
* Knowledge or interest in software development
* Portfolio demonstrating projects delivered with the skills above

#### **What we offer**


We strongly believe in working with individuals who love what they do. When you get the opportunity to do what you do best, the result will be something out of the ordinary.


We offer you to part of a passionate team of really fun UX and product professionals! You will also be part of a global and innovative, fast-growing company at the forefront of technology. We offer competitive benefits and compensation based on competence and performance.


Our brand-new office in the heart of Gothenburg offers a breathtaking panoramic view, Friday breakfasts, and highly skilled Novacurians to hang out with.

#### **How to Apply**


If you believe we're a good match, send in your CV, Cover Letter and Portfolio demonstrating your design process and visuals. Our selection process is ongoing, so seize this opportunity and apply today! For inquiries regarding the recruitment process, please reach out to Ellen Jingrot, Global Talent Acquisition Specialist, at ellen.jingrot@novacura.com. For questions regarding the position, please contact Christian Fransson, Lead UX Designer, at christian.fransson@novacura.com.

#### **About Novacura**


At Novacura, we are passionate about delivering solutions that enable our customers to work smarter and faster in their businesses. We work with a variety of business systems and offer our unique product - Novacura Flow, a low-code development platform that extends ERP systems, among other applications. We are a global organization with close collaboration among our offices in different countries, and we have high ambitions for continued development and growth in all our markets.

title: UX/UI Designer Intern
company_industry: Software Development, Manufacturing, and IT System Training and Support
description:
**XR Solutions** 
 is a technology based company that utilizes machine learning and powerful research-based optimizations to provide practical, reliable and optimizing augmented reality solutions to industrial companies.
 



 We believe that our AR technology can change working methods, the way of thinking and enable new innovative solutions that previously was not achievable in industry and machine operation.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We are seeking a passionate and dedicated
 **UX/UI Designer** 
 to join our team for an Internship. This is an exciting opportunity for someone looking to gain hands-on experience in Design, Marketing and XR within a fast-paced and supportive environment.
 



  





**You will among other things be work with:** 




  




* Be involved in all stages of the design process within projects; from research, workshops, idea generation, concepts to prototypes and delivery of design.
* Create marketing content and be a part of taking our product to market.
* Create interaction design through customer journeys, sketches, wireframes and prototypes based on insights.
* Use creative tools like Figma and other suitable design software in the XR space.
* Conducting deep interviews and workshops for user research and product testing.
* Monitor and design the interface for head-mounted XR glasses and how the user should integrate with the software (e.g. Hand movements, eye tracking, etc.)



  





**To succeed in this role, you should have** 




  




* Previous of relevant work experience in UX/UI and
 **XR Design** 
 (
 **Meritorious)**
* An ability to easily communicate and work with others in teams, both with colleagues and customers.
* A self-propelled working method
* An ability to choose the tools and methods that best suit each specific situation.
* A user-focused mindset – a passionate drive for understanding and meeting user needs.
* Experience with Figma
* Open mindset to try new working methods and software tools that just launched on the market.



  





**What we offer** 



* Practical experience of e.g. product development in the AR-Space
* Opportunity to contribute directly to the growth of an exciting Startup
* Remote work and flex Office spaces
* Strategic work and planning
* Be part of a product launch



  





 If you’re excited about this opportunity and eager to learn, please send your resume outlining your interest in the position. We look forward to helping you grow your skills and advance your career in Design and marketing.
 



  





 This is a unpaid internship initially

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
At Ubiquiti Inc., we create technology platforms for Businesses, Smart Homes, and Internet Service Providers, driven by our goal to connect everyone, everywhere by Rethinking IT. To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions. At Ubiquiti, you’ll heighten your potential and broaden your horizons, while shaping the future of connectivity.
   

  

**We are currently looking for a highly skilled UX/UI Designer to our team in Stockholm, Sweden.**
***Please note that applicants must live in Sweden and hold a valid work permit at the time of application to be considered for this role.***
**Responsibilities**
* Design high-quality and user-friendly interfaces for web and mobile. Examples: UniFi Network app, UniFi Protect app, UniFi Design System, ui.com, store.ui.com, design.ui.com and more
* Embrace a design-first approach, pushing the boundaries of design by working on new and innovative ideas
* Co-work with key stakeholders including leadership, strategists, developers (FE/FS) and other designers
* Navigate an agile work environment, iterating quickly yet maintaining high quality
* Actively participate in mulitple projects across the company and voice your ideas on design improvements


**Requirements**
* Expert level UX and UI design skills
* Minimum five (5) years of experience designing interfaces for web and mobile
* Highly proficient in Figma
* Strong interest in working hands-on with design, considering both user experience and UIs
* You take full ownership of your tasks and responsibilites
* Genuine passion for great UX
* Excellent communication skills and highly proficient in English (written and spoken)


**Nice To Have**
* Knowledge about networking & wireless technologies
* Experience with Adobe After Effects or any other animation tool for interactions
* Skilled in Cinema 4D or Blender


**Benefits**
* International work environment
* Competitive compensation package including wellness allowance, occupational pension, medical insurance, private health insurance, life insurance and work-injury insurance
* Five weeks of holiday per year
* Flexible work hours and hybrid work model
* Modern office space located in Epicenter (Hötorget)
* Access to all the latest Ubiquiti products and prototypes for home use and tests

title: UX/UI designer, Solna
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Be a part of creating the digital customer experiences of the future with us at PostNord. Join the UX design team in Stockholm!
   

  

 Join the UX team at PostNord and help shape outstanding customer journeys with a user-centered mindset. As a UX/UI designer, you’ll collaborate with fellow designers within a dedicated user segment, working on multiple services to create seamless and impactful experiences.
   

  

 Join us
   

  

 We, the UX team, are working in an agile environment where the teams independently owns the product from start to finish. Within the team, it is important that everybody has their say, and we always strive to improve our way of working.
   

  

 Our head office is in Solna, Stockholm
 ***.***
 We make sure to meet each other in our office in Solna, at least three days per week.
   

  

 Find out more and follow us on LinkedIn!
   

  

 To be successful in this role, we believe that you are a UX/UI designer that wants to be a key player and take ownership. You will work closely with business, product owners, developers and other UX designers and make sure we build the best customer journeys.
   

  

 As a person, we believe that you are full of initiative and solution oriented. You have good communication skills and thrive when you get to work both practically and close to our users. You are no stranger with facilitating meetings or workshops and visualizing requirements. You have great knowledge and experience in designing for web and native applications for iOS/Android.
   

  

 You have a great personal drive and adapt efficiently to new information and insights. Like us, you value teamwork and building great solutions together.
   

  

 Your profile
   

  

* Relevant education in UX design, interaction design, service design or equivalent field.
* Minimum 3 years of work experience as a UX/UI designer
* Facilitation skills and able to take ownership and get things done
* Design user flows and interfaces for our digital services in Figma
* The ability to analyze and design user flows based on insights collected via interviews and other mediums such as Hotjar/Google Analytics
* Experience in designing user interfaces for both web and native apps
* Understands graphic design and typography
* Understands designing for accessibility and WCAG requirements
* Experience in planning and conducting user tests
* Fluent Swedish and English


 Job Responsibilities
   

  

* Conducting user research, both qualitative and quantitative, as well as analyzing and presenting insights to revenant product teams and the whole department
* Analyzing and following up on user research
* Designing overall user flows and interfaces for our digital services on the web
* Working closely with product owners, other designers and other stakeholders within PostNord
* You’ll be responsible in aligning your work with other UX designers and user segments, on how it might affect PostNord’s multiple customer journeys.


**We offer you**
* A great team, you are part of a team with a focus on creating amazing customer-facing solutions at Postnord.
* Agile is our way of working, we have weekly’s, daily's, refinement meetings and sprint retros.
* Flexible hybrid workplace with an open working climate.
* To be part of a large organization with endless development opportunities for you as a UX designer and individual.
* Good insurance and occupational pension conditions.
* Wellness allowance and access to office gym and swimming pool.
* Employee benefits through PostNord's own employee foundation PostNord Plus.
* Employment according to a collective agreement.


 We make everyday life easier
   

  

 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless of if we lead ourselves or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at www.postnord.com.
   

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

**Apply**
  

  

  

  

 What are you waiting for? Send your application. Selection is ongoing, so apply as soon as possible. If you have any questions about the position, email sonja.prest@postnord.com. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 Read more about our union representatives.

title: UX/UI-designer
description:
Svensk Byggtjänst ägs av landets ledande organisationer inom samhällsbyggnadssektorn. Vi är drygt 100 kollegor som strävar mot samma mål: ett helt hållbart samhällsbyggande. Det gör vi genom att samla in, validera och erbjuda kunskap till sektorn. Vill du bidra med din kompetens som UX/UI-designer? Välkommen till en flexibel och inkluderande arbetsmiljö, med lika goda möjligheter att jobba på distans som på ett gemensamt kontor.
 



  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Vår Techavdelning är en central del av Svensk Byggtjänst, som har tydligt fokus på digitala erbjudanden. Tech har samtidigt en tvärfunktionell funktion, där du som UX/UI-designer kan påverka upplevelsen av vårt varumärke. Du som söker är erfaren, kreativ och duktig på att skapa användarcentrerade designlösningar – allt för att göra våra tjänster så hjälpsamma som möjligt.
 



  





 Det här behöver vi din hjälp med:
 


* Analysera användarbehov och affärskrav för att utforma intuitiva och effektiva användargränssnitt.
* Skapa användarflöden, wireframes och prototyper för att visualisera och kommunicera designkoncept.
* Genomföra användbarhetstester och analysera användarfeedback för att kontinuerligt förbättra produktionsdesignen.
* Skapa färdig design och designelement som utvecklarteamen använder i utvecklingsarbetet.
* Delta i alla steg av utvecklingsprocessen, från analys till utveckling och färdig lösning.
* Arbeta nära produktteam och marknadsteam för att säkerställa att designen går i linje med Svensk Byggtjänsts vision och mål.



  





**Din bakgrund och person** 



* Eftergymnasial utbildning, gärna högskoleutbildning, inom design, UX, användarinteraktion eller annan relevant utbildning.
* Gedigen portfölj som visar tidigare arbete och framgångsrika projekt inom UI- och UX-design.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med utveckling av moderna, webbaserade lösningar tillsammans med systemutvecklare.
* Van vid att arbeta med analysverktyg som Google Analytics, Hotjar eller liknande.
* Du behärskar verktyg som Adobe Photoshop, Adobe XD, Sketch, Figma eller liknande.
* Meriterande med erfarenhet från samhällsbyggnadssektorn.
* Skicklighet i att identifiera problem, analysera möjliga lösningar och genomföra dessa effektivt.
* God förmåga att planera, organisera och prioritera arbete i en föränderlig och krävande miljö.
* Kommunikativ och gillar att arbeta med olika typer av personer, med olika typer av kompetenser.



  





**Ett stort plus:** 



* Du har kunskap i agila metoder och Design Thinking.
* Du är en skicklig grafisk designer som kan skapa fungerande design från skisser och wireframes.
* Du kan arbeta med och balansera förväntningar från olika intressenter, samt arbeta med förändringsledning.
* Du är bekväm med att kommunicera både på svenska och engelska till olika målgrupper.
* Du har kunskap om frontendtekniker som HTML, CSS och JavaScript.



  





**Om oss** 




 Svensk Byggtjänst ägs av landets ledande organisationer inom samhällsbyggnad. Sedan 1934 har vi samlat in, validerat, strukturerat och tillgängliggjort den kunskap som sektorn behöver. I dag har vi ett tydligt uppdrag från våra ägare: att främja ett hållbart samhällsbyggande. Ett arbete där vi kontinuerligt utvecklar produkter och tjänster för största möjliga branschnytta.
 



  





**Din ansökan** 
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan så snart som möjligt, dock senast 19 juni 2025. Vi arbetar med löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas före sista ansökningsdatum.
 



 Har du frågor? Kontakta gärna Therese Lewenstedt, HRBP på Svensk Byggtjänst, via therese.lewenstedt@byggtjanst.se.

title: Digital Designer
description:
**Background** 




 We are looking for a talented Digital Designer with a strong background in UX, site design, and graphic design to join our growing team. If you excel at crafting innovative, user-centric digital experiences, thrive in e-commerce, and have a passion for designing for a global luxury audience, this role is an exciting opportunity to make an impact.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 As a Digital Designer, you will be a key player in defining and executing Nordic Knots’ digital strategy. Reporting directly to the Chief Growth Officer and collaborating closely with our CEO and Co-Founder, you’ll be responsible for elevating our online presence, ensuring our platforms combine visual excellence with outstanding user experience to drive engagement and sales.
 



 Your expertise will span from crafting seamless user journeys and e-commerce experiences to creating high-impact visual content for marketing campaigns. You will lead digital initiatives, work cross-functionally with teams across the company, and take ownership of delivering results in a fast-paced, ambitious environment.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




  





**User Experience (UX):** 



* Lead the design and optimisation of user journeys across our e-commerce platforms to ensure a best-in-class digital shopping experience.
* Conduct usability research and testing to identify areas for improvement and implement solutions.
* Develop wireframes, prototypes, and user flows to support site updates and campaigns.



  





**Site Design & Visual Merchandising:** 



* Develop and maintain the look and feel of our website, ensuring it aligns with the Nordic Knots brand identity.
* Design and implement layouts, landing pages, and category pages optimised for engagement, sales, and user experience.
* Collaborate with the e-commerce team to ensure the digital storefront reflects trends, seasonal priorities, and customer insights.



  





**Graphic Design:** 



* Produce visually striking assets for social advertisements, banners, email campaigns, and digital marketing initiatives.
* Provide art direction and oversight to ensure a cohesive visual language across all platforms and campaigns.
* Elevate the creative impact of the brand’s digital presence through innovative design concepts and storytelling.



  





**Collaboration:** 



* Work closely with the e-commerce, marketing, and product teams to execute campaigns, product launches, and seasonal promotions.
* Partner with the content and social media teams to ensure unified messaging and visuals across all channels.
* Collaborate with external creative partners and vendors when required.



  





**Performance Analysis:** 



* Use analytics tools (Google Analytics, Microsoft Clarity, or similar) to evaluate site performance and optimize designs based on data-driven insights.
* Stay ahead of industry trends in e-commerce, UX, and graphic design to implement innovative approaches that enhance user engagement.



  





**Experience & Skills:** 



* 3+ years of experience in UX, site design, and graphic design, preferably in e-commerce or luxury retail.
* Proven ability to design and implement user-centric digital experiences that drive engagement and sales.
* Expertise in design tools like Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, XD, After Effects), Figma, or Sketch.
* Strong understanding of e-commerce platforms (Centra or Shopify experience is a plus).
* Familiarity with iterative design processes and A/B testing methodologies.
* Proficiency with analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Hotjar, or Microsoft Clarity) to inform design strategies.
* Experience in art direction for digital campaigns, with a strong portfolio showcasing impactful, results-driven work.



  





**About us** 




 Nordic Knots is a Scandinavian Textile house founded in 2016 by Liza Berglund Laserow, Fabian Berglund and Felix Berglund. We are a fast-growing direct-to-consumer interior brand that was born from a culture of thoughtful design that lasts beyond seasons and trends. Fusing function and aesthetics with a Scandinavian sensibility, we craft timeless textiles for the modern home. We believe that great textiles are foundational and can transform a house into a harmonious home – framing the most beautifully curated lives. Nordic Knots headquarters are located in Stockholm with growing teams in both Stockholm and New York.
 



  





**What we offer** 




 We are a fun and driven team with high ambitions. We have an entrepreneurial and open-minded culture where all new ideas and suggestions for improvements are valued and encouraged. At Nordic Knots everyone should feel that they are a part of and contributing towards our success as we continue to scale up the brand with many exciting projects on the horizon.
 



  





 At Nordic Knots we stand for a diverse and inclusive workforce. We seek talented individuals who bring a range of perspectives and inspired ideas. We welcome all applicants eager to join a dynamic team.
 



  





**Location** 




 We are looking for a candidate located in Stockholm.

title: Vi söker tjänstedesigner till KTH
description:
Verksamhetsstödets uppgift är att stödja universitetets utbildning och forskning. KTH:s verksamhetsstöd är inne i en spännande fas där vi tillsammans arbetar med utveckling av våra arbetsformer. Som medarbetare inom verksamhetsstödet bidrar du till KTH:s uppdrag att forska, utbilda och skapa samhällsnytta och får samtidigt möjlighet till egen professionell utveckling.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som vill forma KTH:s användarcentrerade arbete
   

  

 Ett av de viktigare strategiska stegen som KTH tar i utvecklingen av arbetsformer är att KTH:s digitala lösningar ska grundas i användarnas och verksamhetens behov. KTH:s IT-avdelning söker nu efter ytterligare en tjänstedesigner till teamet som arbetar med att bygga upp KTH:s användarcentrerade arbete.
   

  

 KTH:s digitalisering är organiserad i fem delportföljer; Utbildning, Forskning, Ledning, Infrastruktur och IT. I rollen ingår att samla kunskap om användarna och deras resor, sprida kunskapen samt att själv delta som designer i större utvecklingsinsatser. Parallellt med detta förväntas du samarbeta med andra ledande roller i att utveckla ett gemensamt arbetssätt där användbarhet och tillgänglighet är en viktig del av helheten. Vi söker därför efter dig som antingen är van att leda medarbetare och utveckla arbetssätt eller ser det som ditt nästa steg i karriären som designer.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Som tjänstedesigner kommer du ingå i ett team, så kallat portföljkontor. Där kommer du samarbeta med olika roller som verksamhetsanalytiker, lösningsarkitekt och verksamhetsspecialister för att bygga förståelse för verksamheten, hantera behov och designa lösningar. Du kommer i den rollen arbeta kontinuerligt nära användare och beställare från verksamheten. Arbetsuppgifterna innebär att:
   

  

* Kartlägga verksamhet/användare inom en delportfölj genom användningsstudier, intervjuer m.m. samt visualisera resultat i t.ex personas, användarresor, effektkartor m.m.
* Kravställa och/eller designa användbara och tillgängliga digitala lösningar.
* Stödja och vägleda utvecklingsuppdrag i fråga om användbarhet och tillgänglighet.
* Genomföra användningstester och utvärdering av framtagna eller upphandlade digitala lösningar.
* Utveckla KTH:s förmåga avseende UX-design genom utveckling och förbättring av metoder, modeller, verktyg m.m.


 Ditt ansvar i teamet:
   

  

* Alltid sätta användaren och verksamheten först, noga avvägt mot målsättningar och förutsättningar.
* Tillsammans med teamet leda arbetet med att kartlägga och förstå verksamhetens och användarnas behov samt förutsättningar som är relevanta för uppdragens målsättningar.
* Säkerställa att lösningsdesign beaktar användarnas behov och förutsättningar.
* Stödja teamens medarbetare i det operativa arbetet om research och design.
* Bevara och dela kunskap om verksamhetens och användarnas behov och förutsättningar.
* Rekommendera processer, metoder, verktyg, dokumentation m.m. som är effektiva och ändamålsenliga för arbetet.


**Vi erbjuder**
* En anställning på ett ledande tekniskt universitet som skapar kunskap och kompetens för en hållbar framtid.
* Engagerade och ambitiösa kollegor samt en kreativ, internationell och dynamisk miljö.
* Möjligheten att bygga upp förmågan att arbeta användarcentrerat på KTH tillsammans med ett team av erfarna designers.


 Läs mer om hur det är att arbeta på KTH samt våra förmåner.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
**Krav**
* Relevant akademisk utbildning alternativt examen från relevant YH-utbildning inom UX-design.
* Minst fem års erfarenhet av UX- och/eller tjänstedesign från research till design.
* Erfarenhet av arbete med webbtillgänglighet, efterlevnad och utvärdering av WCAG 2 eller senare versioner.
* God förmåga att uttrycka sig i tal och skrift på både svenska och engelska då det krävs i det dagliga arbetet.


 Personliga egenskaper
   

  

 Vi söker dig som samarbetar konstruktivt och positivt med personer med olika kompetenser. Du är kommunikativ och argumenterar för värdet av design med fokus på helhetsupplevelsen. Du trivs med att arbeta i team och tycker om att ha många kontaktytor utanför det, samtidigt som du har en förmåga att driva arbetet självständigt. I arbetet är du lösningsorienterad och flexibel, du kan tänka nytt och utmana befintliga lösningar och samtidigt ha tålamodet att driva långsiktig förändring. Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid dessa personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Meriterande**
* Minst kandidatexamen från högskola eller universitet.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av att planera och leda projekt/uppdrag.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet från en myndighet.
* Erfarenhet av att jobba som UX-designer i ett utvecklingsteam.


**Fackliga representanter**
 Kontaktuppgifter till fackliga representanter.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Du ansöker via KTH:s rekryteringssystem. Du som sökande har huvudansvaret för att din ansökan är komplett när den skickas in. Ansökan ska vara KTH tillhanda senast sista ansökningsdagen vid midnatt, CET/CEST (CentralEuropean Time/Central European Summer Time).
   

  

 Om anställningen
   

  

 Anställningen gäller tillsvidare enligt avtal.
   

  

 Anställningen inleds med sex månaders provanställning.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Strävan efter jämställdhet, mångfald och lika villkor är både en kvalitetsfråga och en självklar del av KTH:s värdegrund
   

  

 För information om behandling av personuppgifter i samband med rekrytering.
   

  

 Det kan förekomma att en anställning hos KTH är placerad i säkerhetsklass. Om så är fallet för just denna anställning görs en säkerhetsprövning av sökande i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) efter samtycke. I dessa fall är en förutsättning för anställning att sökande blir godkänd efter säkerhetsprövning.
   

  

 Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av platsannonser.
   

  

 Om KTH KTH är ett av Europas ledande tekniska universitet och en viktig arena för kunskapsutveckling. Som Sveriges största universitet för teknisk forskning och utbildning samlar vi studenter, forskare och fakultet från hela världen. Vår forskning och utbildning omfattar såväl naturvetenskap som alla grenar inom teknik samt arkitektur, industriell ekonomi, samhällsplanering, historia och filosofi. Läs mer här
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidare med provanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: PA-2025-0989 | Kontakt: Kristian Fäldt, Gruppchef 070-7967808, | Publicerat: 2025-04-07 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-05-05

title: Graphic Designer
description:
Join Our Diverse Team At Crane Currency In a Graphic Design In Tumba And Be a Part Of Our Journey Towards Innovation And Excellence. Who We Are
   

  

 Crane Currency is a premier industrial technology company and a pioneer in currency manufacturing and advanced micro-optics technology for securing physical products. Yes, chances are you have our product in your wallet right now! Our sophisticated equipment and software leverage proprietary core capabilities with detection and sensing technologies. Around the world, our customers trust us to anticipate their needs with innovative, reliable, and high-quality currency & authentication solutions and services—just as they have for generations.  Learn more at
   

  

**How You Will Make An Impact**
 As a Graphic designer, you work with in Banknote design team to create details and concepts for secure and visually appealing currency that helps prevent counterfeiting. Your artistic skills and attention to detail ensure that each banknote is not only functional but also a work of art. By incorporating advanced security features, you protect the business and the economy from fraudulent activities. Your designs instill confidence in the currency, fostering trust among users and stakeholders. Ultimately, your work supports the financial stability and integrity of the business and the broader economy.
   

  

**In Your Role You Will**
* Create and Design Banknotes: Develop secure and visually appealing designs for new banknotes and redesign existing ones. Support with Graphic design content, typography and illustrations.
* Incorporate Security Features: Integrate advanced anti-counterfeiting measures into banknote designs to prevent fraud.
* Collaborate with Stakeholders: Work with government officials, security experts, and printing companies to ensure designs meet all requirements.
* Conduct Research: Investigate cultural and historical elements to incorporate into banknote designs, ensuring they are meaningful and relevant.
* Develop Prototypes: Create and test prototypes to ensure the durability and functionality of the banknotes.
* Document Design Processes: Maintain accurate records of all design activities and provide detailed specifications for printers and engravers.


****Knowledge and expertise that matter most for this role:****
**Required**
* 
* 1 - 3-year university level education in arts & crafts and graphic design or commensurate experience.
* 
* 3 -5 years’ experience within the field of graphic design.
* 
* Knowledge of graphic design software such as Illustrator, Photoshop and in design.
* 
* Fluent in English.


**Preferred**
* 
* Experience working with team and with continues improvements


***Ability to showcase artwork and graphic design, including drawings (portfolio submission preferred)***
**Benefits**
****Tumba-Benefits****
****How we will care for you:****
 We offer top-notch medical benefits including a wellness allowance and reimbursement for medicines and medical care, opportunities for personal development, community engagement activities, competitive compensation, vacation, parental leave, and multiple tiers of retirement plans. Discover more about our benefits here
   

  

**What Drives Our Team**
 We are a passionate team of 1,200 creators and problem solvers, united by our purpose, we give people confidence every day in moments that matter. This comes to life through our Shared Values:
   

  

* People Matter
* Do the Right Thing
* Trusted Partner
* Innovate for Growth
* Always Improving


**Learn More About Our Values And Culture**
 You can also check us out at:
   

  

**Where We Are**
 Your role is in Tumba, Stockholm, located in the historic Tumba Bruk area, five-minute walking distance from the train station, 30 km south of Stockholm, and about 20 minutes from Stockholm Central Station. Check out what makes Tumba a great place to live and work here:
   

  

 Crane Currency is a drug free workplace.
   

  

 Crane NXT is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, national origin or any other characteristic protected under applicable local law.

**#ONSITE**

title: Webredaktör
description:
**Web Editor** 




  





 Are you a skilled communicator with a sharp eye for detail and a passion for creating engaging online experiences? We’re looking for an experienced Web Content Editor to take hands on responsibility in crafting and optimizing high-quality web content across a dynamic portfolio of several health care brands. In this role, you’ll play a key part in shaping our user experience, and driving performance through strategic and converting content. If you thrive in a fast-paced, scale-up environment —this is the opportunity for you.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  




* Write, edit, and publish web content including articles and product descriptions
* Review and update existing content to ensure accuracy, relevance, and freshness.
* Adhere to brand guidelines and maintain consistent tone and style across all web content
* Ensure all content is optimized for SEO and user experience
* Maintain the website’s editorial calendar and schedule updates or new content as needed.
* Monitor web traffic and user engagement metrics to improve content performance.
* Ensure compliance with accessibility standards and digital best practices



  





**Requirements:** 




  
 


* +5 years work experience as a web editor, digital content specialist, or similar role
* Vast experience from working with content management systems (e.g., WordPress, Hubspot)
* Excellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills
* Basic knowledge of HTML/CSS and SEO best practices
* Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
* Experience with analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics).
* Knowledge of UX/UI principles and responsive web design.
* Graphic design or photo editing skills (e.g, Canva).



  





**Why Join Us?** 



* Be part of a scale-up organization managing a diverse range of brands across the Nordics.
* Opportunity to make a real impact on the digital consumer journey for trusted brands.



  





 Ready to take on the challenge? Apply now!

title: Staff Product Designer
description:
*Natural Cycles° is a leading women’s health company that developed the world’s first birth control app, used by millions globally. We are a fast growing startup, and we promote an international working environment filled with smart and ambitious colleagues based in Stockholm, Geneva, New York, and remotely. Our mission is to pioneer women’s health through research and passion, empowering every woman with the knowledge she needs to take charge of her health.* 




  





 We’re seeking an experienced Staff Product Designer to spearhead the creation of our app's innovative AI assistant and reimagine its core educational and customer support features. You’ll define how our users learn about women’s health and their own bodies. You’ll have significant design ownership across a broad surface area, shaping core experiences that directly impact user engagement, trust, and retention.
 



  





 By joining our team, you’ll get the opportunity to collaborate on a variety of projects with a team of top product designers, product managers, and engineers in a fast-paced, rapidly growing, environment.
 



  





**Please note that we are hiring for this role in Sweden.** 




  





**You have…** 



* Strong UX skills with experience working on complex user flows. Experience with service design is a plus.
* Strong UI skills to develop new educational features for our app’s knowledge hub. You have the ability to make learning about women’s health interactive and engaging.
* Experience using quantitative data and user research to inform your design decisions. You may even have lead interviews or analysed data yourself (not only will you collaborate with user researchers and data analysts, you’ll design features to collect user feedback and scientific research data.)
* A strong portfolio demonstrating similar past work.



  





**You are…** 



* Interested in AI and chatbot design
* Able to work independently and comfortable owning projects from start to pixel-perfect finish. You thrive in an environment that fosters autonomy and trust.
* A strong communicator with excellent presentation skills. You’re comfortable receiving constructive feedback and working closely with developers.



  





**What we offer** 



* Flexible work arrangement - you will be part of a team based in and around Stockholm that values effective collaboration and transparent communication, irrespective of work location
* Professional development - you will collaborate with industry leading developers, promoting continuous growth and skill enhancement
* Modern technology - you will leverage innovative technologies and tools, within an environment that empowers you to contribute ideas and take ownership of your work
* Impactful projects - you will contribute to groundbreaking projects that redefine industry standards and create tangible value
* Commitment to quality - you will join a dynamic and progressive organization that prioritizes profitable, long-term product development



  





**Location** 




 We are remote-friendly, but we find great value in being able to connect with our teams in person. Most of the product development team you will work with is located in Stockholm.
 



  





**Sounds interesting?** 




 If you want to be part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position as soon as possible. Please include your portfolio in your application.
 



  





 We look forward to hearing from you!
 



  





  





**How to apply** 




 To apply, just upload your CV and portfolio, then answer the questions on the application form. Keep in mind that we can't accept applications through email because of GDPR, and only applications submitted via the career site (and in English) will be considered.
 



  





 At Natural Cycles we value diversity and inclusion because we know that teams with people from different backgrounds and experiences are stronger. We welcome candidates from all walks of life and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.
 



  





**Note: We are not looking for consultants or help from recruitment agencies**

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us— and let the world feel your work.**
**The role**
 As a Senior Product Designer at Epidemic Sound, you'll play a key role in shaping our user experience. Your creative ideas and strategic thinking will drive the development of our digital product offering that delights our customers and elevates our brand.
   

  

 Collaborating closely with designers, product managers, analysts, developers, and leadership, you'll help build and ship intuitive, visually appealing products that meet both user needs and business objectives.
   

  

**Your key responsibilities include:**
* Own the user experience and design output for your product team, ensuring high-quality results
* Lead end-to-end design processes, driving excellent outcomes for prioritized initiatives
* Identify UX gaps and opportunities, shaping strategic improvements
* Influence product strategy by leading visioning and user experience planning
* Foster a culture of design sharing, feedback, and critique within the team
* Contribute to the evolution of design systems, patterns, and standards, ensuring consistency and scalability across platforms


**Requirements:**
* Strong craft skills in user experience and digital user interface design
* Excellent communication, presentation and storytelling skills
* In depth knowledge of established UX and UI patterns
* In depth knowledge in applying design processes and methods to effectively take lead on complex key initiatives
* In depth knowledge in planning, conducting and synthesizing user research
* In depth knowledge of understanding and following up on data and analytics
* Knowledge in how to effectively manage stakeholder relationships to influence others and lead change


**Soft Skills**
* Ability to inspire and lead through excellent design craftsmanship
* Positive, constructive attitude that energizes and motivates others
* Clear, effective communication of ideas and justification for design decisions


**Equal opportunity employer**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Ready to make the world feel your work? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link “apply” below.
   

  

**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
*Vi tror på ett samhälle format av framgångsrika företag där entreprenörskap och samhällsnytta går hand i hand. Att vara en del av Fortnox är att vara en del av en ständig förändring - en förändring där du själv bestämmer hur långt du vill nå. Vårt största fokus är att ge dig rätt förutsättningar att få leva din passion tillsammans med oss. Var du kommer ifrån är inte relevant - det är vart du är på väg som är intressant för oss. Precis som vi igår inte kunde drömma om det Fortnox som finns idag, så kan du vara med och forma vilka vi är imorgon.*
**Om tjänsten**
 I rollen som Senior Product Designer (PD) arbetar du med en kort och medellång tidshorisont nära, utöver andra designers, även tätt med Product Managers (PM) och Design Area Manager (DAM). Du arbetar främst med en av produkterna i produktområdet Byråstöd och Rapportera. Det är ett avancerat och hårt reglerat område där du snabbt behöver sätta dig in i regelverk och lagar tillsammans med övriga designers. Många gånger handlar det om att göra något komplext till något enkelt. Tillsammans med PMs och DAMs kommer du ha möjligheten att bidra med idéer och prioritera utmaningar för att förbättra användarupplevelsen - både för olika användargrupper samt inom olika produktområden.
   

  

 I samarbete med ledande designroller inom ditt område, ansvarar ni för kundens och användarens upplevelse av produkten. Tillsammans utvecklar ni visuella koncept som balanserar värde för användaren med regler och lagar samt affärsmässig potential.
   

  

 Du samarbetar närmast PDs och DAM inom ditt område och eftersom teamen är distribuerade behöver du vara flexibel med utgång från din placering.
   

  

**Vi söker dig med**
* Ett kreativt tänkande med många års erfarenhet (5+år) av arbete med UX och UI för digitala produkter.
* Förståelse för det kommersiella värdet av gott samarbete mellan Design, Produkt och Utveckling.
* En vana att jobba tätt med utvecklare.
* En god erfarenhet av UX-Research och UI. Samt lång erfarenhet av produktdesign (konsument-appar med stora användarbaser).
* Ett holistiskt sätt att se på en produkt och förmåga att både sätta upp visioner och mål samt att inspirerande förmedla dem.
* Ett arbetssätt där användarresor, prototyper, interaktionsdesign och mockups är vardagsmat.
* En förmåga att ledigt kommunicera och samarbeta med PM, UX, utvecklingsteam och användare.
* Erfarenhet av att jobba med och hantera designsystem.
* Figma och FigJam som designverktyg samt vana vid researchverktyg.
* Förmåga att ledigt hålla och driva strukturerade workshops.
* Har vana att använda UX-designprocesser för att designa lösningar för användar- och affärsutmaningar.
* Är ledig i kommunikations- och lagarbete och känner starkt för att undvika jobb i silos.
* Är flytande i svenska i såväl tal som skrift
* Meriterande är naturligt erfarenheter kring produkter och arbete med applikationer och system för redovisningsnära produkter påverkade av gällande lagstiftning eller liknande.
* Meriterande är även erfarenhet av att mentorera juniora designers.


 Till detta ser vi gärna en god meritlista för levererad utmärkt design och en stark portfölj.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 En möjlighet att vara en del av en unik utvecklings- och tillväxtresa, och aktivt bidra till att inte bara vara bäst på marknaden utan även leda densamma.
   

  

 En dynamisk arbetsmiljö där passionerade kollegor vet att det vi gör, gör stor skillnad för företagssverige.
   

  

 Flexibilitet och att arbeta på distans, samtidigt som vi vill erbjuda en kreativ arbetsmiljö för våra medarbetare. Majoriteten av teamen sitter på huvudkontoret i Växjö eller knutna dit, men vi har också medarbetare i Linköping och Stockholm. Teamen jobbar 2–3 dagar på kontoret och vi söker dig som också vill komma in till kontoret då och då!
   

  

**Om Fortnox**
*Fortnox AB (publ) är en företagsplattform som knyter samman människor, företag och organisationer. Vi hjälper företag starta, växa och utvecklas. Med smarta tekniska produkter, lösningar och tjänster, och möjlighet att koppla ihop dem med hundratals externa parter, är vi ett nav för företagande i Sverige. Vår vision är att skapa ett välmående samhälle format av framgångsrika företag. Fortnox grundades 2001 och har huvudkontor i Växjö samt kontor i Malmö, Linköping och Stockholm. Aktien är noterad på Nasdaq Stockholm. För ytterligare information se* 
*www.fortnox.se* 
*.*
**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: React Native Engineer
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Wellness and Fitness Services
description:
**Role:** 
 React Native Software Engineer - React, Next.js, PostgreSQL, GCP
 



**Sector:** 
 Health & Wellbeing sector
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
 



  





 Fuuel are seeking an experienced,
 **React Native Mobile Engineer** 
 who loves building beautiful, performant mobile apps and wants to make a real difference in women’s health. You’ll be a key part of our mission-driven team, shaping the mobile experience and helping us scale to reach more women around the world. If you’re excited about React Native, UX, and health-tech innovation, we’d love to connect.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 As a Mobile Engineer, your primary focus will be on developing and maintaining our React Native app built with Expo. You’ll work closely with product, design, and data teams to deliver impactful features, improve performance, and ensure a seamless user experience on both iOS and Android.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 



* **React Native Development:** 
 Lead feature development using React Native (Expo), ensuring smooth performance and native-like UX.
* **UI/UX Implementation:** 
 Collaborate with designers to translate Figma designs into polished mobile interfaces.
* **Mobile Performance:** 
 Continuously optimize app speed, responsiveness, and stability.
* **Data-Driven Improvements:** 
 Use analytics and feedback to improve features and user



 flows.
 


* **Testing & Quality:** 
 Write clean, maintainable code with strong test coverage and



 attention to detail.
 


* **Team Collaboration:** 
 Work closely with PMs, designers, and QA to ensure timely, high-



 quality releases.
 


* **Security & Compliance:** 
 Help keep our mobile app secure and compliant with health



 data regulations (e.g. GDPR, HIPAA).
 


* **Innovation:** 
 Contribute ideas, explore new technologies, and help us stay ahead in



 mobile health-tech.
 



  





**Qualifications:** 




 • 3+ years of experience in
 **mobile app development** 
 , with a strong focus on
 **React Native (Expo)** 
 .
 


* Solid understanding of mobile architecture, performance optimisation, and debugging.
* Experience publishing apps to the
 **App Store and Google Play** 
 .
* Familiar with mobile analytics tools (e.g. Firebase, Mixpanel, Amplitude).
* Strong attention to UI detail and a user-first mindset.
* Experience working in agile teams and with CI/CD workflows for mobile.
* Passion for building products that make a real-world impact.



  





**Nice-to-Haves:** 



* Experience with
 **Nestjs (TypeScript)** 
 ,
 **Postgresql** 
 , or building/maintaining backend APIs.
* Familiarity with
 **Google Cloud Platform** 
 , or other cloud services.
* Experience in health-tech, subscription-based apps, or wellness platforms.
* Background in
 **A/B testing** 
 , user behaviour analysis, or mobile growth strategies.
* Exposure to
 **machine learning** 
 , personalisation, or predictive features.
* Understanding of health data regulations like
 **HIPAA** 
 and
 **GDPR** 
 .



  





 If you are excited by this fantastic opportunity, please submit an updated version of your CV as soon as possible for immediately consideration.

title: Oracle Techno-Functional Consultant
description:
Do you want to be a part of Accenture and design Oracle SaaS Solutions & integrations to optimize solutions in our data centers for our clients?
   

  

 This role provides the opportunity to work with cutting-edge Oracle cloud technologies while supporting mission-critical business processes across a variety of industries. If you are passionate about Oracle solutions and thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, we encourage you to apply!
   

  

 Accenture is Oracles largest global partner and has a strong community for Oracle technology. We are a team that focuses on the Oracle ecosystem and in this role, you will focus on how Oracle's solutions can help our customers.
   

  

**Job Requirements:**
 We are seeking a highly skilled
 **Oracle Techno-Functional Consultant** 
 with expertise in
 **Oracle SaaS and PaaS applications** 
 . The candidate will play a key role in designing, implementing, configuring, and supporting Oracle Cloud solutions, integrating systems using
 **Oracle Integration Cloud (OIC)** 
 , managing Oracle SaaS & PaaS Security and data migration processes.
   

  

 We are looking for you who worked for some or a few years with a focus on:
   

  

  

- Oracle Integration Cloud Platform or similar Integration platform/ tools from Oracle.

- Has experience with different Integration Patterns for Integrating with Oracle Fusion SaaS applications & other cloud applications with knowledge of creating Rest, Soap Services and using FBDI (File-Based Data Import) Patterns for Data Import/Export.

- Have experience working with BICC Connectors to export data from Oracle Fusion SaaS, Oracle BI Publisher, and OTBI for reporting and analytics

- Have experience with Oracle Identity cloud service for OCI and Oracle SaaS Fusion Applications Security & Controls, Oracle Cloud Security policies and procedures. Work with Oracle Identity and Access Management (IAM) for secure cloud access to ensure data security and compliance.

- Have experience with Oracle Application Development, Customizations, and extension of Oracle Fusion applications using VBCS (Visual Builder Cloud Service).

- Have experience with Oracle Redwood and can collaborate with developers and UI/UX designers to deliver intuitive and user-friendly interfaces for Oracle SaaS applications.

- Have knowledge or experience in designing and developing scalable web applications using Oracle Application Express (APEX). Develop custom PL/SQL packages, functions, and procedures to support the APEX applications.

**Roles & Responsibilities:**
- Work closely with our customers to improve and optimize their infrastructures with a focus on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.

- Analyze customer needs and create requirements and solutions based on these Set up, document, and test various Oracle solutions.

- Help our customers manage their systems and see how they can be improved over time

- Work in and lead project teams, often consisting of members from around the world

- Work agile with the possibility to create prototypes

- Work on both local, Nordic, and global projects

- Stay up to date on Oracle products and build deep expertise

- Join a global network of Oracle OCI & Oracle Fusion experts

**Pre-Requisites:**
- Interested in working as a consultant

- Has a university degree in a relevant field, e.g. IT or engineering

- Have experience leading people in teams

- Fluent in Norwegian and English, or willingness to learn. Other Nordic language can be an advantage

- Ability to travel in periods

- Worked as a consultant, Architects, Techno Functional roles

- Oracle SaaS & PaaS Certified

**We offer you:**
- A unique opportunity to work with varied and interesting clients. One of Accenture's strengths is our broad client portfolio, which includes many of our leading companies in very different industries

- A day of learning - we put a lot of focus on both building knowledge within Oracle, but also general knowledge required to be able to help our customers and deliver successful projects

- Balance between work and free time - we find solutions to put the life puzzle together

- Work both remotely and on-site - most of our projects today allow a flexible way of working with a combination of on-site and remote

- Mentorship and ongoing discussion to accelerate your career

- Social groups and events – e.g. Accenture Play which focuses on those who like e-sports and Accenture IF for those who like everything from football to skiing

- Language training and language cafes to learn Norwegian

 Does that sound interesting? Submit your CV and cover letter. We are looking for candidates on an ongoing basis.

title: Manager Windows & Linux, Integration platforms – IT Infrastructure & Operations
description:
Job Title
Manager Windows & Linux, Integration platforms – IT Infrastructure & Operations
Job Description*Axis is a global and intimate company at the same time. Small enough for you to have a complete overview of what happens. Big enough to make an impact across the globe. The combination is magnetic. If you ever wanted to know what it is like to create a global solution of leading technology through a small team of experts, this is your chance.* *Join our journey to build the future of Axis Platforms and Integrations! We're seeking a senior leader and manager to lead our Windows & Linux/Integration platform team.* *We are building to handle existing and future challenges in a company that doubles in size every five years and is the global leader in our industry.*
Your future team
As a manager within the IT Infrastructure & Operations department, you'll lead the Windows & Linux/Integration team, overseeing Axis' global platforms. Your team of approximately 10 specialists will drive the future development and strategy for these critical platforms. We're looking for someone who shares our passion for innovative technology solutions. Together, you'll develop and implement strategies and tactical plans to ensure Axis’s platforms are secure, available, and reliable.
What will you do here?
As a manager in this role, you'll have the chance to lead a team that sets the strategic direction for our global Platforms, developing roadmaps that enable Axis to meet future business needs. In this technically complex environment, you'll need to balance multiple priorities and manage stakeholder expectations. As part of a truly cross-functional team, you'll collaborate closely with various colleagues in different parts of Axis.
Your key responsibilities will include:* Leading, coaching, and developing a prosperous team through recruitment, individual growth, and mentorship.
* Together with you colleagues defining and driving platform strategy and goals that align with business objectives.
* Collaborating with teams and stakeholders to ensure that the platforms live up to expectations of today, tomorrow and in the future.
* Developing, tracking, and controlling annual operational and capital forecasts.
* Ensuring successful project delivery and alignment with roadmaps & strategies.
* Translating business requirements into strategic platform and infrastructure directions.


Who are you?
We're looking for an experienced and confident leader who has been leading technical teams. You're comfortable navigating complex, fast-paced global environments and embracing change. You're an open, driven, and empathetic individual who genuinely cares about people and recognizes the impact of your leadership on team performance and engagement. We think you have your starting point in technology and understand how technology can impact the growth of Axis. You may have a university degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related experience. You may have a background in different platforms with a solid understanding of operating systems such as Windows, Linux, and cloud-based platforms. A plus is if you are familiar with containerization (e.g., Docker), orchestration tools (e.g., Kubernetes) as this is part of the team’s responsibility.
We believe you will need some of the skills & knowledge below:* Proven management experience with a focus on growth & development.
* Strong vendor and technical management skills.
* Excellent communication skills and experience from global collaboration.
* Nuanced understanding of global IT complexities.
* Self-driven approach with strategic thinking.


What Axis has to offer
By joining Axis, you will embark on an exciting journey of personal and professional growth. We will offer you a great introduction to Axis with training.
