 tWith over 40 million visits each month, you’ll be part of Sweden’s most popular property platform – and one of the world’s most admired real estate platforms. But our size and reputation aren’t the only reasons why you and your 150+ colleagues enjoy working here
   

  

 .Since 1998, Hemnet has been an essential go-to place for millions of Swedes, guiding them through one of life’s biggest transitions: finding a new place to call home. We’re proud to make this life-changing, often stressful journey as seamless as possible
   

  

 .With access to vast amounts of data, you’ll have limitless opportunities to explore and create new features that enhance the experience for Sweden’s real estate agents, home buyers, and sellers
   

  

 .Our friendly Hemnet culture fosters a dynamic, playful environment where every voice is valued. Here, you’ll join a welcoming team that encourages you to thrive and grow, working alongside passionate colleagues from around the world
   

  

**.A Hybrid Way of Workin**
 gOur vibrant office in central Stockholm is the hub of our collaboration and culture, providing a lively space that fosters team spirit. We come together in the office three days a week, with two flexible remote days. To be part of our team, it’s essential to be based in or near Stockholm.

title: Solutions Architect - Hardware
description:
Are you passionate about shaping the future of hardware and firmware architecture?
   

  

 At ASSA ABLOY Global Solutions, we're looking for a Solutions Architect – Hardware to join our team. In this role, you'll thrive in a collaborative, innovative culture that empowers you to build a career to be proud of. Based primarily in Stockholm, Sweden, you will play a critical part guiding hardware and firmware development
   

  

**What you would do as our Solutions Architect - Hardware**
 As a Solutions Architect - Hardware, you will work closely with the Global Solutions CTO, engaging with Business Areas to understand their customers, use cases, and technical needs. You’ll play a key role in guiding hardware and firmware development, ensuring alignment across the division, and identifying opportunities for collaboration and technology reuse. Your expertise will support mergers & acquisitions, product generation planning, and emerging technology adoption.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Develop a deep understanding of Business Areas’ hardware portfolios and contribute to a Divisional Product Catalogue.
* Align hardware requirements across Business Areas to minimize duplication and streamline development.
* Provide technical guidance on hardware and firmware architecture, supporting new product introductions.
* Engage in Group-level initiatives, ensuring divisional alignment with broader hardware strategies.
* Stay at the forefront of emerging technologies, evaluating their potential impact and applications.
* Actively support M&A activities, advising on technology integrations and opportunities.
* Foster collaboration across divisions, encouraging knowledge sharing and best practices.
* Support compliance with regulations and standards, ensuring products meet required certifications.


**The skills and experience you need:**
 We are looking for someone who:
   

  

* 5+ years of experience in hardware and firmware development, preferably in a strategic role.
* Expertise in electromechanical locks, access control solutions, and RFID technologies.
* Strong understanding of hardware development methodologies and firmware architecture.
* Ability to translate technical concepts for different audiences.
* Fluency in English both written and verbal.


 The ideal candidate possesses a strong understanding of emerging regulations and standards, along with their potential impact on the business. They have excellent knowledge of how products and technologies can be combined to create superior solutions and can effectively communicate technical matters in a way that aligns with the audience's level of expertise. A great team player, they demonstrate strategic thinking with a long-term vision and the ability to formulate and implement effective plans. Additionally, they have the ability to influence and guide others, leveraging their technology background and experience in developing hardware products to drive innovation and success.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* Hybrid model of working & Competitive salary package
* Flexible working hours
* Stable employment in a friendly international atmosphere


**We review applications regularly, so don't wait.**
 We are building diverse and inclusive teams and encourage applications from all who can envision themselves working with us.
   

  

 To ensure that your personal information is secure, we do not review any applications sent via email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, please send an email to Khalil Kabakibi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at Khalil.kabakibi@assaabloy.com.
   

  

 Let's together create a safer and more open world!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com.
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Channel Sales Graduate
description:
**About this Position** 
 Join us as a Channel Sales Graduate and get the opportunity to become a game changer to our team, working alongside professionals from diverse backgrounds to achieve common goals and drive organisational success. This is how you can dare to make an impact:
 **What you´ll do**
* We offer you a real hands-on Sales graduate role within an international company, operating in various market areas.
* You will get an overview of company’s and sales department’s business activities and processes.
* You will be part of our Channel Sales team where you will assist the Head of Channel Management North, Head of ACM Sales and Key Account Managers.
* Your task will include e.g., maintain, optimise, and analyse different reports and system data, create material for our distributors and support Henkel Channel Sales team with diverse ad hoc tasks.
* The role also includes own project that varies depending on customers, market and internal needs.
* The brand portfolio contains the worldwide known brands Loctite and Teroson.
* You will work in the Channel Management department for Adhesive products at our Nordic headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden.


**What makes you a good fit**
* You should graduate (before September 2025 and no more than two years prior) with a Bachelor’s, Master’s (or equivalent) degree in Business, Economics or a related field.
* As a person you are business oriented, analytical, communicative, co-operative and a good team player.
* You are fluent in English and one Nordic language (either Danish, Finnish, Norwegian or Swedish).
* Strong IT skills; excellent knowledge of MS Office tools especially Excel and PowerPoint. Knowledge of Power BI or SAP would be an advantage.
* You have a positive attitude and is eager to learn and develop your professional skills.
* You are available for 12 months from September 2025.


**Some perks of joining Henkel**
* Flexible work scheme with flexible hours, hybrid work model, and work from anywhere policy for up to 30 days per year
* Diverse national and international growth opportunities
* Globally wellbeing standards with health and preventive care programs
* Gender-neutral parental leave for a minimum of 8 weeks
* Employee Share Plan with voluntary investment and Henkel matching shares
* Meal Allowance
* Sports compensation allowance
* Full access to extensive learning hub
* Subsidised Massage


 At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different genders, origins, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, disabilities, and generations.

title: Client Director/Marketing Advisor
description:
**OM HOLY COMMS** 




  






 Holy Comms är en snabbväxande kommunikationsbyrå i Stockholm. Vi definierar oss som en Marketing as a Service-byrå (MaaS) och lägger stor vikt vid att skapa flexibla, skräddarsydda och abonnemangsbaserade lösningar för våra kunder. Vi jobbar bland annat med aktörer som Gårdschips, MSAB, QleanAir och ABG – men även ett stort antal innovativa startups. Vi är övertygade om att digitaliseringen har bidragit till att alla företag idag, inte bara de allra största, har ett snabbväxande behov av marknadsföring.
 




  






 Holy Comms erbjudande innefattar ett kluster av tjänster och områden som PR, content marketing, performance film och foto, kampanjer, sociala medier och strategi, vilket gör vårt erbjudande både brett och spetsigt, eller som vi har definerat det "Holystic". Vi tror på långsiktiga kundrelationer och lägger stor vikt vid att alltid leverera lite bättre än sist. Vi drivs av våra tre värdeord flexibilitet, transparens och snällhet.
 




  






 Att välja Holy Comms innebär precis vad du vill att det ska innebära. Vi är en fullservicebyrå, absolut, men vi är också en partner som brinner för att hjälpa dig att nå dina drömmar. För vi vill att alla som har en dröm och ett driv ska ha möjligheten att skapa fantastisk kommunikation. Därför utgår vår modell från flexibla månadsabonnemang med transparent prissättning
 





 Vi är under snabb tillväxt, är 35 personer och sitter just nu i centrala Stockholm på Tegnergatan.
 




  





**OM ROLLEN** 




  






 Denna roll utgör en mycket viktigt del i Holy Comms erbjudande till våra kunder. I rollen agerar du som våra kunders strategiska och operativa rådgivare tillsammans med övriga kollegor på Holy Comms. vi på Holy Comms erbjuder våra kunder att skräddarsy sina kommunikations och marknadstjänster där behoven månad för månad kan skilja sig åt.
 




  






 Vi har experter brett inom marknad och erbjuder våra kunder allt i från effektiv content till marknadsstrategier. I denna roll kommer du att fylla rollen som motsvarar en marknadsansvarig där du tillsammans med våra kollegor säkrar att alla våra leveranser håller en röd tråd och skapar mesta möjliga värde för våra kunder. Alla våra kunder har olika behov och har olika mognadsgrad och syfte med sin kommunikation. Vissa har en egen marknadsavdelning där vi
 





 är en stöttande funktion, vissa kunder har vi ett helhetsansvar då vi erbjuder en komplett marknadsavdelning.
 




  






 Denna roll utgör navet i Holy Comms erbjudande där ansvarar för att våra kunder erbjuds de tjänster som de behöver för att nå sina mål. Tillsammans med creatives och strateg ansvar du för att kunden får ut mesta möjliga av sitt abonnemang och för Holy Comms skapar ett reelt värde för kunden. 
 




  






 I denna roll har du ett helhetsansvar för dina kunders abonnemang. Du ansvarar för alla delar av projektets livscykel: uppstart, strategi, produktion, distribution, mätning och optimering. Vi är en startup, därför är det viktigt att du kan hantera hela kedjan – från uppstart av en helt ny kund till att förädla långvariga samarbeten och relationer.
 





  
 




  






 Du kommer att jobba med kunder som aldrig förut gjort något online likväl som att addera det där lilla extra till marknadsavdelningar i framkant. Våra kunder verkar inom ett stort antal olika branscher – från retail till fintech. Det är därför viktigt att du tycker att det är roligt med mixen, och att sätta dig in i nya områden.
 




  






 Några av dina arbetsuppgifter innefattar:
 




  




* Hantera dina kunders abonnemang och vara deras kontaktperson – du ansvarar för projektens innehåll, tidplan och leverans
* Beställa och projektleda produktioner internt från kollegorna på vår Creative-avdelning som deltar i dina kundteam
* Löpande förbättra och förädla varje kunds samarbete
* Pitcha in nya idéer till dina kunder
* Ansvara för att produktion och distribution genomförs i dina kundprojekt



  





**VEM ÄR DU** 




  




* Du är  kundorienterad och sätter kundernas framgång och leverans i centrum
* Du har kanske erfarenhet av arbete som marketing manager eller haft en annan liknande roll på en marknads eller kommunikationsavdelning
* Du har god vana vid kundansvar och är självgående i kundrelationen
* Du är innovativ och har inte brist på idéer – det kommer naturligt för dig att löpande se hur kundprojekten kan utvecklas
* Du är ansvarsfull, har koll på både helhet och detaljer och skulle aldrig missa en deadline
* Du är en people person som har lätt för att bygga goda relationer
* Du är tech-savvy och håller dig uppdaterad kring nya tekniker, kanaler och metoder inom digital kommunikation – du behöver inte kunna allt, din inställning till att lära dig nytt är viktigast
* Du är van vid att leda och koordinera (andra) kreatörer
* Du är snabb, driven och gillar ett högt tempo, men tummar för den sakens skull inte på kvaliteten
* Du delar vår syn om att kommunikationsbranschen skulle må bra av en dos förändring



  






 Vi på Holy Comms tror på att vara snäll, flexibel och transparent och ser att du delar de värderingarna. Redan från start har Holy Comms varit ett enkelt bolag att arbeta med, vi finns där för våra kunder och vi tycker det är viktigare att våra kunder når sina mål än att vi vinner ett guldägg. Vi är inte svåra eller diffusa, för vi vill att alla som har en dröm och ett driv ska ha möjligheten att skapa fantastisk kommunikation.
 




  






 .Är det dig vi söker? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag, urval och intervjuer sker löpande. CV och personligt brev mailas till 
 
 fredrik@holycomms.se

title: Commercial Advisor
company_industry: Retail, Financial Services, and Legal Services
description:
**We are looking for a Commercial Advisor for a global company in Stockholm. Start is in June, 6 months contract to begin with.** 




  





  





 To provide commercial expertise to the Business Tech product organization, in order to deliver expected business value throughout the product life cycle. Commercial Advisors support by bringing rigor to business cases, executing deals that achieve business objectives, and identifying ways to optimize ongoing relationships with external partners. You must have a proven track record from managing dealmaking processes including RFPs, tendering and time planning.
 



  





  





 The Commercial Advisor has great leadership skills, believes in a non-hierarchical culture of collaboration, transparency, safety, and trust. Working with a focus on value creation, growth and serving customers with full ownership and accountability. Delivering exceptional customer and business results.
 



  





  





**Responsibilities:** 



* Support product leaders in defining and implementing commercial and partner strategy
* Negotiate with external partners to secure advantageous terms
* Screening of potential new partners and collaborations relevant for the product area
* Working with product leaders to define and secure the business case
* Establish relevant type of commercial model/cooperation most likely to serve the business case
* Define and implement strategic parameters for the partner portfolio and ensure its optimal long-term management
* Perform collaboration and performance management according to framework and assess risks vs expected business outcome
* Perform risk management for partner and vendor contracts and agreements
* Challenge existing commercial models setups and suggest new commercial/contractual strategies
* Devise negotiation strategy and best suited process for the deal
* Identify potential deal designs to reflect deal objectives, eg. risk aversion vs. creating optionality
* Manage deal making processes required such as RFP, tendering crafting, time planning etc.
* Ensure compliance Purchasing and Consultant Policy
* Carry out deal making and secure alignment to initial deal objectives
* Continuously acquire knowledge of the product domain/area through supplier and market analyses
* Monitor and act on spend analyses
* Support set up for collaboration and governance between product stakeholders, partners and vendors
* Managing contract life-cycle such as extension, renegotiation, termination, call-offs



  





  





**Skills and Abilities:** 



* Analytical skills (KPI’s, business case construction)
* Strategic thinker who can connect the objectives of a business case to the actions needed to execute
* Problem-solving capabilities and pragmatic outlook
* Negotiation and conflict-resolution skills
* Ability to influence and persuade others
* Solid communication skills, including being able to provide challenge in a constructive manner
* Ability to set plans and to bring others along – cross-functional or interdisciplinary background a plus
* Activator - noticing things and initiating action (actively optimizing)
* Proactive questioner
* Results-oriented, concrete, pragmatic, efficient
* International deal making experience
* Experienced with, and understands, a wide variety of deal structures including to negotiate cloud agreements (SAP, Google, Microsoft etc)



  





  





**This is a full-time consultant position through Incluso in Stockholm. Start is in June, 6 months limited contract to begin with.** 




  





  





 Please submit your CV as soon as possible since we will review the applications on an on-going basis.
 



  





  





 For more information about this role, please contact Emma Hörnsten at emma@incluso.se, recruiter at Incluso.

title: Engineering
description:
**About Agama**


Do you enjoy watching films and series, wherever you are and whenever you want? Or maybe you’re one of those who prefers to let the TV channel decide what’s on for the evening? No matter your preference, we’re behind it making sure it’s an enjoyable experience for you. We translate videos into numbers. We’ve developed a distributed system capable of analyzing hundreds of channels and hundreds of gigabits of video in real-time. Simultaneously we are processing data from many millions of viewers and devices, resulting in billions of data points every minute, pushing both hardware and software to the limits.


But we need you to continue our journey! The development department at Agama is a tightly-knit team and with us, you have a chance to make a big impact. We know that we can only succeed by working together, taking responsibility and growing together, as individuals and as a collective.


We have a new open position, see below. We would love to hear from you!

**Junior Software Engineer**


As a software engineer at Agama, you can develop in one or several areas covering real-time systems, video analysis, distributed systems, microservices, containers, customer integrations and web-based UIs.

**What will you do:**

* Work with a small team of software engineers and product managers.
* Solve complex problems that are vital both to the customers and to Agama’s success.
* Design, write, test, improve, deploy and document the solutions; you will be a part of all the development phases.
* Work with cutting-edge technologies.

**Who are you:**

* Studying towards a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or related field.
* You have a strong problem-solving ability.
* You know how to write readable and maintainable code in one or several languages such as C, C++, Python or JavaScript.
* You are fluent in both written and spoken English.
* You have built an app of any kind or have an ongoing project that you can show us.

**Why Agama**


Our team of about 30 employees develops, markets, and sells our software-based solution almost all over the world. You will be part of our development team which consists of a diverse, creative group of people of various ages, skills, and backgrounds.


As an employee at Agama, you get the opportunity to work in a flexible environment, with interesting and developing technology at a company with an attractive culture that values its employees and having fun together!

title: Sales Engineer
description:
**Who we are ‍️**  

At Findity, we're the driving force behind Europe’s most advanced expense management solutions. With our tech, over 30,000 companies and 290,000+ employees simplify their financial routines and gain control with confidence. We're not just building tools - we're shaping the future of business finance.  

  

  



**What we do**  

At Findity, we’re on a mission to take the hassle out of expense management - for individuals and businesses alike. Since managing expenses is often a necessity, not a choice, we partner with top-tier software providers and financial institutions to make the process seamless, smart, and stress-free. So you can focus on what truly matters.

 **The role ️**  

As our Sales Engineer, you'll be the go-to technical expert supporting our New Business team throughout the sales cycle. You’ll join forces with our sales reps to engage with prospective partners and guide them through technical evaluations, integration questions, and product capabilities. Your mission is to make complex things simple, build trust, and help turn opportunities into long-term partnerships.


If you thrive at the intersection of business and technology and are a tech-savvy professional who enjoys solving complex problems, talking to partners and helping close high-impact deals? Then this might be the role for you!


In this role, you will be responsible for the following:


* Join meetings with prospects as the technical and product expert
  
* Introduce our prospects to Findity’s APIs and how to best integrate with us
  
* Scope the prospects current APIs, available provisioning data and more to make sure that our systems can be integrated in the best way possible.
  
* Translate business needs into tailored technical solutions
  
* Create and present solution proposals and system architecture
  
* Answer questions related to integrations, APIs, SSO, and technical setups
  
* Work cross-functionally with our product and engineering department
  
* Run internal product training sessions for sales teams
  
* Support with technical configuration and onboarding of new partners

  

**Qualifications**  

We believe you’re someone who brings a unique mix of curiosity, communication, and technical skills. To thrive in this role, you likely have:

* 3+ years of experience as a Sales Engineer or Solutions Engineer from another B2B SaaS company
  
* Solid understanding of APIs and the ability to map out and explain technical flows and system architecture
  
* Familiarity with ERP, Payroll, or Accounting systems and how they integrate
  
* Excellent communication skills and fluency in English
  
* Knowledge of JavaScript, databases, and accounting principles makes you stand out from the crowd

  

**Apply Now!**  

Excited about embarking on your new career journey? Fantastic! Send us your application in English as soon as possible!

title: Knowledge Engineer - Retail Concept
description:
* **Job ID:** R0011575
* **Date posted:** 28/04/2025
* **About us…**
* We are on the journey to consolidate the digital capabilities and business processes at Retail Concept across the leadership areas IKEA Retail Experience, Brand & Marketing, Learning and Development and Expansion. A journey that needs passionate people who embrace change and development, dare to question and want to make a difference. If that sounds like you, come and join us. Together we can do great things so IKEA can be an even better home furnishing retailer in the future.
* The main responsibility areas in the Retail Concept Operations (RCO) following the new Inter IKEA operating model are
* + Retail processes End-to-End
	+ Digital capability areas
	+ IKEA.com and IKEA.net channels
	+ ROSS
* In short, the responsibility areas are described below
* Retail processes End-to-End: The retail process is to describe how IKEA work with retail throughout that value chain. It start with our identity, the range. How the we manufacture and supply the range to the franchisees and then how to communicate, sell and customer fulfillment. The process indirectly defines the capabilities IKEA need and at least half of the process and capabilities is defined and managed by the franchisees.
* Digital capability areas: It is the different capabilities the support retail concept and consist of both subject matter experts, process people but also the digital tools as needed. Tools as currently provided are for example IKEA Digital Design System Skapa, IKEA Knowledge graph, Visa Retail Guidance, Range Selection Tool etc..
* IKEA.com and IKEA.net channels: Is the external brand building top domain of IKEA online. It is not the sales channel that sit on the franchisee side, but the rather the part that explain for the customer audience of who we are.
* Retail Operation Solution and Support (ROSS): It is the combined upper funnel of IKEA.com retail websites as mainly contracted by IKEA IT AB but also the lower funnel of customer checkout, payment, order orchestration, fulfillment, finance, customer support and supply. This is a combination of capabilities from Supply and the Microsoft 365 Dynamics Enterprise resource planning (ERP) platform provided as a service to most of the non INGKA franchisees.
* The job as Knowledge engineer is an software engineering assignment in the context of semantic technologies for Retail Concept ontology domain fitting our part of the reality into the IKEA context.
* **About you…**
* You believe that creating great digital products means that they are fit for purpose and software engineering is a mean for supporting the business. You have extensive experience in software engineering where you have worked hands-on with semantic technologies for at least 3 years. You are also used to work together with
* architecture and other engineers and you are curios to learn new things. As knowledge engineer and as part of the IKEA knowledge graph context, you must have a big interest of have to digitalize knowledge that normally sit in people heads into scalable knowledge that can be used by machines. You are also used to work in agile teams with high autonomy.
* **In addition, we believe that you:**
* + Minimum 7 years of software development experience
	+ Minimum 3 years of hands-on working with semantic technologies
	+ Experience with RDFS, OWL, SHACL, and SKOS for ontology modeling, validation, and controlled vocabularies in semantic systems.
	+ Proficient in using RDF modeling tools (we use Metaphactory) for knowledge graph development and management.
	+ Experience in customizing modeling tools to meet specific business needs, including adding new functionalities and integrations
	+ Hands-on experience with graph databases (we use RDF Fox)
	+ Understanding of graph-based data models and their application in semantic systems.
	+ Strong knowledge regarding querying, reasoning over rule-based data, and optimizing queries for faster processing and efficient data retrieval (we use Datalog)
	+ Deep understanding of SPARQL, the query language for RDF data, with the ability to craft complex queries to extract and manipulate data from RDF-based knowledge graphs.
	+ Ensure high performance and scalability of knowledge graph systems through optimization techniques
	+ Experience in agile and domain-driven product development
* **As a knowledge engineer, you will**
* + Be the bridge from the more abstract IKEA ontology model into the runtime data graph by continuously improve and optimize it
	+ Work together with ontology modelers, data engineers, business SME´s regarding making sure that reasoning, rule-engine, inferencing logic, data pipelines optimize the data graph for our consumers.
	+ Work together with the central IKEA Knowledge graph team and the other Inter IKEA domains (such as Range and Supply)
	+ Work together in a highly cross-functional agile teams following regular scrum ceremonies
	+ Ensure modularize, scale, integration while meeting resiliency, performance, reusability, along with business and architecture goals
	+ Contribute to adoption of design patterns, efficient usage of cross-cutting technology platforms and solutions to reuse across product teams in the domain to enable efficiency and avoid unnecessary duplications.
	+ Contribute to the exploration and further development of new technologies to improve system performance and reliability and position stack evolution in the architecture strategic roadmaps.
	+ Create detailed technical documentation for knowledge graph solutions and customizations.
	+ Work closely with stakeholders to align technical implementations with business goals.
	+ Follow existing engineering practices and implement those.
 **More Information*** This position is full-time (40 hours per week) and is located in Malmö, Sweden. Some travel will be required.
* Please send your application – CV in English latest 12th of May 2025. We really want to get to know you, so make sure you tell us why you want to work at IKEA and why you would be a good fit for this role.
* In this role you will be reporting to the Software Engineering Manager.
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: EBM Process Development Engineer
description:
**Job Description Summary**
===========================


Come join us at Colibrium Additive as an EBM Process Development Engineer! As a development engineer at Colibrium Additive, you will be a part of a team of application and material experts working collaboratively to develop the Electron Beam Melting (EBM) process. The EBM process is the core of our technology, and you will interact various disciplines that collectively form the EBM Engineering and Technology team.  

  

At Colibrium Additive, part of GE Aerospace, we develop and design the most advanced metal 3D-printers in the world. Our state-of-the-art machines are engineered by our team in Sweden, manufactured in Germany, and utilized globally to produce items such as medical implants and turbine blades for jet engines. The EBM division of Colibrium Additive has the benefit of being a smaller, agile company with the resources of a global enterprise. You will work closely with colleagues in Germany and US, as well as with customers around the world.**Job Description**
===================

**Roles and Responsibilities**

* Master the operation of our EBM machines
* Optimize process parameter settings for established materials for the EBM machines
* Qualify material processes for release, including both existing and new materials
* Conduct material lab work, including tensile testing and microscopy
* Develop and evaluate melt process tools, encompassing both software and hardware
* Enhance our internal work process and quality assurance process
* Participate in development projects within cross-functional teams
* Support the service organization with customer issues and contribute to customer projects
* Assist the sales organization and product management with your expertise

**Required Qualifications**

* M.Sc. in Physics or Material Engineering
* 0-5 years’ work experience
* Basic understanding of six sigma tools and data-driven development
* Basic programming skill (e.g. python)
* Oral and written communication skills in English

 **Desired Characteristics**


As an individual, you are positive and possesses excellent communication skills. You are both structured and pragmatic, bringing energy and drive to the teams you work with. You solve problems collaboratively with the team and maintain a humble approach. You are eager to learn from your senior colleagues while also being capable of challenging them in daily tasks.


You are a true engineer who enjoys working across various fields of technology and science and collaborating with professionals from diverse backgrounds.

**We offer**


As an employee at Colibrium Additive, part of GE Aerospace, we are pleased to offer you a dynamic, flexible and technically advanced position with a wide array of employee benefits. These includes flexible working hours, health and pension insurance, and of course a positive work-life balance. We provide an exciting global working environment that will offer you valuable experience and contribute to your professional development. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with highly committed colleagues from diverse cultures. It is our people that make the difference!


Colibrium Additive is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters.


#LI-MW


#LI-Hybrid

**Additional Information**
==========================

**Relocation Assistance Provided:** No

title: Summer job - Database Development & Data Management
description:
Are you currently studying at a university or college and looking for a meaningful summer job? At Mycronic, you get a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience at a global high-tech company at the forefront of technology.


Mycronic is a global high-tech company whose innovative solutions have been advancing electronics technology for over 40 years. Today we continue to grow and serve customers in an expanding variety of industries. What we do impacts the future of technology, and in turn, the way we live our lives tomorrow.  



**Background**

Today, no other company can compete with Mycronic's mask writers. Our machines are used in the manufacturing of nearly all displays — from TVs and laptops to smartwatches and car infotainment systems — and even in semiconductor production. The process for the manufacturing happens at a nanometer level, smaller than blood cells and viruses. For all of this to be possible, a great emphasis is put on the quality of software and hardware.


Mycronic's photomask equipment consists of many subsystems that produce data, which is then analyzed for many different purposes. For example, the mask writers utilize a multi-axis servo to position the laser beam that performs the actual writing of the masks, and all the motions in the system are logged and analyzed to ensure stable system operation. Another important aspect in the manufacturing of lithographic masks at nanometer-scale precision is the ability to measure and verify in the measured data that the patterns match the expected performance.


Much of this analysis and decision-making is done today with a combination of manual analysis and statistical methods. Machine learning- and deep learning-based analysis offers several potential advantages over more traditional rule-based methods, for example reducing the amount of manual work needed, higher sensitivity for potential issues, or identifying more complex relationships that might be difficult to find with classical statistical analysis.  



**Description**

The goal of the summer project is to design and implement a SQL database. The initial steps will include conducting a needs analysis, followed by the creation of a conceptual data model. The next phase will involve designing and implementing the SQL database, along with migrating our existing data into the new structure. Naturally, testing and quality assurance will be important parts of the project.


Responsibilities:


* Design and implement a database structure based on specific business needs.
* Create necessary tables, relationships, and indexes to ensure optimal performance and data integrity.
* Migrate existing data from various sources to the new database, including data cleaning and transformation when needed.
* Document the database schema and the processes used for data migration.
* Perform tests to ensure the database functions as expected and that all data has been correctly transferred.
Qualifications:


* Ongoing or completed education in computer science, information systems, or a related field.
* Experience with database management systems such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, or SQL Server.
* Proficiency in SQL and experience in database design and normalization.
* Ability to work independently and take initiative.
* Attention to detail and a high level of accuracy.
Merits:


* Experience with data migration and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes.
* Knowledge of scripting languages such as Python or Bash for automating data handling tasks.
* Previous experience with similar projects.
The duration of the summer work is 8-12 weeks, and the location is primarily at Mycronic’s headquarters in Täby just outside of Stockholm.  



**Details**

Application deadline: We review applications on an ongoing basis, and positions may be filled before the application deadline 2025-05-12.
  

How to apply: Apply through our website by answering the application questions and uploading your CV.  



**Contact and further information**

David Lutman, Group Manager, PG Process Metrology and Test Center, david.luthman@mycronic.com.


Nils Pallarés, Data Scientist Engineer, PG Process Metrology and Test Center, nils.pallares@mycronic.com .

title: CFD Engineer - Stockholm
description:
FS Dynamics already has the largest CFD team in Stockholm, but we need more motivated, technically driven engineers for our consulting services in fluid dynamics and CFD. At FS Dynamics, you will find yourself in a stimulating, non-prestigious and developing environment with other top-class CAE engineers. Together, we create value at the forefront of technology and deliver computational assignments of the highest quality. We are now looking for an engineer in fluid dynamics and CFD to join our team in Stockholm. Both newly graduated and engineers with a few years of relevant experience are of interest to us.
  
What we offer you﻿
  
FS Dynamics is an engineering consultancy company specializing in simulations within fluid dynamics (CFD) and structural mechanics (FEA). We select our colleagues carefully based on both technical competence and personal qualities. As an CFD engineer at FS Dynamics, you will be part of Sweden's leading CFD and FEA consultants where collaboration and development are of utmost importance. Assignments are carried out both at our offices and on customer sites. Our customer base is diverse, and through assignments and collaboration with colleagues, you will have the opportunity to deepen and broaden your skills within several different industries, as well as within fluid dynamics and CFD. This provides a varied and inspiring work environment with opportunities for personal development in the consultant role.
  
Who are we looking for?
  
Applicants must have completed an MSc or PhD degree in relevant education and it meriting to have good practical experience with one of the following software: ANSA, STAR-CCM+, Ansys Fluids or GT-SUIT. Industrial experience as a computational engineer in fluid dynamics is an advantage. We highly value the ability to understand customer needs and address these using effective simulations, as well as the ability to communicate well with clients and colleagues in both Swedish and English.
  
About us
  
FS Dynamics is a focused and unique CAE consultancy company, primarily active within FEA and CFD. With over 150 CAE engineers in Sweden, Portugal, Finland, and Germany, we are the leading premium CAE consultancy firm in Northern Europe.
  
Application
  
Send your application with personal letter, resume and university course transcripts to recruitment@fsdynamics.se with the subject line “CFD engineer – Stockholm”. We welcome all applicants with relevant experience regardless of background, ethnicity and gender. Applications are evaluated continuously.
  
Please note, for this position only candidates with work permit in Sweden will be considered.
  
We handle all applications in accordance with our privacy policy for job applications:
  
https://fsdynamics.se/job-applicant-privacy-policy/

title: AI Engineer
description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and talented entry level AI Engineer to join our growing team. In this role, you will have the exciting opportunity to work at the forefront of both traditional machine learning and cutting-edge generative AI. You will contribute to the development and implementation of AI solutions that address real-world challenges in the financial services industry. This role requires a strong foundation in AI/ML principles, software engineering skills, and a collaborative mindset.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

**Develop and implement machine learning models:** Design, build, and train traditional machine learning models (e.g., regression, classification, clustering) for tasks such as risk assessment, trade prediction, and operational efficiency.
  
**Explore and apply generative AI techniques:** Research, experiment with, and implement generative AI models (e.g., transformers, large language models) for applications like data augmentation, synthetic data generation, anomaly detection, and natural language processing in financial contexts.
  
**Collaborate on AI solutions:** Work closely with experienced AI engineers, data scientists, and software developers to integrate AI models into Osttra's existing systems and build new AI-powered applications.
  
**Contribute to software development:** Participate in the full software development lifecycle, including design, coding, testing, and deployment, adhering to best practices and industry standards.
  
**Analyse and interpret data:** Analyse large datasets, identify patterns and trends, and derive insights to inform model development and business decisions.
  
**Stay current with AI advancements:** Continuously learn and keep abreast of the latest research and trends in both traditional machine learning and generative AI.
  
**Communicate effectively:** Clearly communicate technical concepts and findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

**Education:** Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related field.
  
  

**Technical Skills:**  

Strong understanding of fundamental AI/ML concepts (e.g., supervised/unsupervised learning, deep learning, natural language processing).
  
Experience with Python and relevant AI/ML libraries (e.g., Keras, scikit-learn).
  
Familiarity with generative AI models and frameworks (e.g., transformers, GPT).
  
Proficiency in software engineering principles and practices.
  
Knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and databases.
  
  

**Soft Skills:**  

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
  
Ability to work independently and as part of a team

title: Frontend Engineer - React & React Native
description:
Since our inception in 2017, Anyfin has empowered thousands across Sweden, Finland, Germany, and Norway to manage their finances better, saving millions through smart refinancing options. We’re growing rapidly and have big ambitions on the horizon, with new markets to explore and impactful products to launch. To fuel our mission, we’re seeking a dedicated and talented Frontend Engineer who’s ready to create seamless and innovative digital experiences for our users across web and mobile platforms.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 As a Frontend Engineer at Anyfin, you’ll play an essential role in building and enhancing our user-facing applications, ensuring they are intuitive, performant, and visually stunning. You’ll collaborate closely with designers, backend engineers, and product managers to deliver world-class solutions across web and mobile platforms. Here’s how you’ll contribute:
   

  

* Feature Development: Design, develop, and maintain features across our web and mobile platforms using React and React Native. Build reusable components and front-end libraries that promote scalability and efficiency. Contribute to our mobile app’s development using React Native, ensuring smooth functionality and aesthetic appeal on both iOS and Android.
* UI Implementation: Collaborate closely with our design team to bring pixel-perfect UIs to life, utilizing styled-components for visual consistency and Storybook for efficient component management.
* API Integration: Integrate with our GraphQL API, ensuring that data is managed seamlessly within the app, fostering efficient client-server interactions that keep our app performing at its best.
* Code Quality & Type Safety: Write well-structured, maintainable code with a strong focus on TypeScript for clarity and type safety, promoting a clean codebase and scalable solutions across the development lifecycle.
* Experimentation & Growth: Partner with our product team to implement and track features through Growth Book experiments, helping optimize user engagement and continuously improving our mobile experience.
* Testing & QA: Develop and maintain automated end-to-end tests to ensure stability and high-quality code delivery, allowing us to release with confidence and reliability.


**Who You Are**
 You have a passion for frontend development and have worked with React and TypeScript, either professionally or through personal projects. You’re eager to learn and contribute to building highly interactive web applications. While experience with React Native is a bonus, your willingness to grow into this area is what counts most. You value writing clean and maintainable code and enjoy collaborating with designers and other engineers to bring ideas to life. You’re curious about working with APIs, experimenting with new ideas, and ensuring a great user experience through testing and iteration. Most importantly, you thrive in a supportive team environment where learning and growth are celebrated.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
 At Anyfin, you’ll find a team driven by purpose, curiosity, and a shared ambition to make a difference. We promise a challenging and rewarding journey that will sharpen your skills, expand your creativity, and allow you to work on meaningful projects. Plus, enjoy the benefits of a centrally-located Stockholm office, competitive compensation, extra time off on your birthday, and many other perks we’ll share when we meet!
   

  

 Are you ready to help us revolutionize financial well-being for all?
   

  

 Apply today, and let’s build something amazing together. We believe that innovation thrives in person, so we work from the office four days a week to foster collaboration and creativity.
   

  

***Please note that we are not offering relocation support for this position.***
 Anyfin is a fintech on a mission to simplify loan repayments and improve the financial well-being of millions. We help consumers reduce the costs of high-interest loans, and take control of their repayment plan.

title: Fullstackutvecklare C#/Node till Team Content
description:
****Vill du arbeta i ett fantastiskt team som möjliggör att våra kunder får den bästa digitala upplevelsen när de ska boka och åka på resor!****
**Om tjänsten**
 Vi söker en fullstackutvecklare till vårt Content-team. Teamet har idag backendansvar för att bygga högpresterande APIer som levererar innehåll till alla delar av verksamheten. Teamet utvecklar även verktyg för att verksamheten ska kunna hantera content enkelt och effektivt. Vi har ambitionen att ligga i framkant och jobba med modern teknik. I backendområdet betyder det att vi utforskar nya databassystem och i frontend jobbar vi med AI för att skapa effektiva verktyg.
   

  

 Teamen ansvarar för hela kedjan från kravförståelse, utveckling, deploy till förvaltning och support. Vi jobbar agilt med continuous delivery. Det viktigaste för oss är inte bara vilka tekniker du kan idag utan din inställning, nyfikenhet och viljan att lära nytt och bidra till vår vidareutveckling och kultur. I teamet arbetar vi idag med en del par-/mobbprogrammering och nära verksamheten med snabba feedbackloppar för ständig förbättring.
   

  

 Vi är 13 utvecklingsteam på vår IT-avdelning och vi utvecklar våra system i Microsoft miljö med moderna tekniker, ramverk och verktyg såsom .NET Core, C#, Node, Azure, React, JavaScript, Typescript, MS-SQL, Redis, MongoDB, etc.
   

  

****Vem vi söker****
 Till Ving söker vi nu en nyfiken, engagerad och fullstackutvecklare.
   

  

**Vi önskar att du uppfyller följande punkter:**
* 7+ års erfarenhet av systemutveckling inom C#.Net eller Node samt god kunskap i React.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med dokument- och relationsdatabaser
* Relevant högskole- eller universitetsutbildning.
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift.


**Det är meriterande om du även har erfarenhet av/intresse i:**
* Scrummasteri
* Couchbase
* Molnbaserade tjänster (gärna Azure)
* DevOps
* Par-/Mobbprogrammering


 Vi söker dig som är en teamspelare som värdesätter samarbete och aktivt bidrar till teamets framgång. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper då vi ser att en bra teamdynamik är en förutsättning för våra leveranser.
   

  

****Vi erbjuder****
 Vi erbjuder en spännande och utvecklande miljö där du får möjlighet till en intern karriär. Du får en omväxlande vardag tillsammans med härliga kollegor - vi arbetar i nära samarbete mellan de nordiska länderna för att ge våra gäster de bästa veckorna på året. Vi har bra reseförmåner och dessutom ett högt medarbetarengagemang som år efter år visar sig i vår interna medarbetarundersökning. Vi älskar vårt jobb och välkomnar dig ombord på vår resa i Nordic Leisure Travel Group!
   

  

****Övrigt****
 Tjänsten är en heltidstjänst och placerad på Vings fina huvudkontor på Kungsholmen i Stockholm. Det är möjligt med distansarbete upp till 2 dagar per vecka när det passar med teamet/arbetet. Arbetsspråk är svenska. Intervjuer kommer ske löpande så skicka din ansökan idag!
   

  

 Har du frågor kring tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Susanne Almqvist på susanne.almqvist@nltg.com eller på telefon 070-951 34 32.
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en bakgrundskontroll att genomföras.
   

  

**I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av tester från Alva Labs – ett logiskt problemlösningstest och ett personlighetstest. Testerna utgår från vedertagen forskning och ger oss möjlighet att på ett opartiskt sätt bedöma dina styrkor och eventuella utmaningar i relation till aktuell tjänst. Under rekryteringsprocessen kommer du att få testerna skickade till dig med mer information, är du nyfiken redan nu kan du läsa mer om dem hos** 
**Alva Labs** 
**.**
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**🏄‍♂️ Kul på jobbet**
**🤝 Tjänstepension**
**🌎 Reseförmåner**
**🦉 Utveckling och lärande**
**💗 Well-being**
**💼 Hybrid arbetsplats**
 Läs mer om vad vi erbjuder här
   

  

 Ving ingår i den nordiska resekoncernenNordic Leisure Travel Group.
   

  

 I gruppen ingår researrangörerna Ving Sverige, Ving Norge, Globetrotter, Spies i Danmark, Tjäreborg i Finland, flygbolaget Sunclass Airlines samt våra egna hotellkoncept Sunwing Family Resorts, Ocean Beach Club och Sunprime Hotels. Gruppen säljer ett normalt år runt 1 500 000 resor i de nordiska länderna.
   

  

 Arbetsområde
   

  

 IT

title: Radio Algorithm Developer
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About this opportunity:**
 At Ericsson, we are seeking for a passionate and forward-thinking senior Algorithm Developer to join our team to contribute to Ericsson radio downlink and uplink algorithm design.
   

  

 As a key player in Ericsson PEU Radio, you’ll contribute to the cutting-edge signal processing algorithms in different wireless standardization technologies. Your role will also encompass addressing the hardware characteristics and impairments that are pivotal to the evolution of the radio products.
   

  

 Mathematics, data analytics, digital design, understanding of air interface performance are some of the competencies in our team required to deliver world-class algorithms. Curiosity and interest in these different aspects with strength in one or more of the areas are crucial for you to excel in our team.
   

  

 We are looking for senior radio algorithm developers that will be part of our global team present in Europe, Asia and North America. At Ericsson, we offer a collaborative environment where you can grow, innovate, and make an impact. If you’re ready to take your career to the next level and contribute to groundbreaking projects, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

**What you will do:**
 In your role, you will work with a team to explore, design, simulate and implement the newest radio algorithms used in Ericsson radio products. Key responsibilities of the work are:
   

  

* Radio downlink and uplink algorithm systemization for new 3GPP standard and radio product requirement
* Explore, develop, simulate, optimize and implement the radio downlink and uplink signal processing algorithm
* Develop and implement radio uplink impairment handing algorithm, e.g. AGC, in cooperation with other teams
* Collaborate with ASIC and radio design team to implement the algorithm in the Ericsson ASIC and radio product
* Drive radio energy efficiency using innovative radio algorithms
* Leverage AI and other innovative way to improve radio algorithm design methodology
* Participate in 6G standardization and systemization
* Simulator programming and documentation for the algorithms designed


**The skills you bring:**
* MSc or PhD. in Wireless Communication, Signal Processing, Microwave, Mathematics or related majors
* Proficiency in the field of signal processing, telecommunication systems and radio technology
* Good communication skills in English
* Experience with Matlab/Simulink
* Innovative, adaptable, and collaborative


**Additional qualifications:**
* PhD in areas of signal processing
* Acquainted with wireless standards such as LTE, NR etc.
* Knowledge of C/C++/Python
* Experience with radio algorithm design
* Experience in areas of: RF System Design, ASIC/FPGA Design.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 762681
   

  

 ]]>

title: Fullstackutvecklare med fokus på stabila och hållbara lösningar
description:
Vi söker en erfaren fullstackutvecklare som vill vara med och utveckla lösningar som möter högt ställda krav från både myndigheter och vårdgivare. Hos oss är stabilitet, tydlighet och långsiktighet viktiga nyckelord – vi undviker lösningar som kräver ständig uppdatering, och fokuserar i stället på teknik som är driftvänlig, begriplig och hållbar över tid.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Du blir en del av ett kompetent team med stark samarbetskultur. Du kommer att arbeta med både frontend och backend, och bidra i hela kedjan från krav till produktion. Vi ser gärna att du har vana från både JavaScript/TypeScript-världen (t.ex. Node.js, Vue.js) och backend med C# eller Java. Vi ser test som en självklar del av utvecklingsprocessen.
   

  

 Arbetet innebär kontakter med andra myndigheter och verksamheter, vilket ställer krav på din kommunikationsförmåga – särskilt kring teknisk dokumentation.
   

  

 Vår nuvarande techstack innehåller bland annat .NET, .NET Core, Node.js, Java, Vue.js och Nuxt. Samtidigt är vi inne i en förflyttning mot en mer gemensam och enhetlig plattform. Det betyder att du får möjlighet att både förstå det befintliga och vara med och forma det nya.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som har förmåga att kombinera teknisk skicklighet med ett genuint intresse för samarbete, struktur och kvalitet. Du är självgående och har förmåga att driva ditt arbete framåt, samtidigt som du gärna diskuterar lösningar och delar kunskap med kollegor. Du uppskattar ett föränderligt läge där du får vara med och påverka, och har lätt för att anpassa dig till nya förutsättningar.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
**Krav**
* Akademisk examen inom data- eller systemvetenskap, eller annan relevant utbildning.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av systemutveckling.
* God förmåga att dokumentera och kommunicera tekniska lösningar på flytande svenska, både skriftligt och muntligt.
* Erfarenhet av webbutveckling i JavaScript, HTML/CSS, Node.js och C# eller Java.
* Erfarenhet av både frontend- och backend-utveckling.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med REST- och/eller SOAP-API:er.
* Erfarenhet av container- och plattformsverktyg som OpenShift och Docker.
* Kunskap i databaser som SQL, MongoDB och/eller Elasticsearch.
* Ett stort intresse för att förstå och möta användares och kunders behov.


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av arbete med produkter som omfattas av MDR (Medical Device Regulation).
* Intresse för test och vårdrelaterade system.
* Erfarenhet av utveckling i Linux-miljö


**Vårt erbjudande**
 Vi erbjuder dig en tillsvidareanställning i en organisation som gör skillnad och har stor samhällsnytta. Här får du möjlighet att vara med och forma framtidens tekniska plattform och bidra till en hållbar utveckling. Du kommer att arbeta tillsammans med ett erfaret team där öppenhet, delaktighet och långsiktig hållbarhet är centrala värderingar.
   

  

 Som anställd hos oss får du trygga anställningsvillkor och förmånliga förmåner som bidrar till både din professionella och personliga utveckling. Vi erbjuder även hybridarbete med kontor på Lindhagensgatan i Stockholm, vilket ger dig flexibilitet och en god balans mellan arbete och fritid.
   

  

 Vi har kollektivavtal och med det följer kollektivavtalade försäkringar, tjänstepension och möjlighet till löneväxling. För att du ska kunna ta ansvar för din hälsa erbjuder vi friskvårdsbidrag samt subventionerad sjukvård i form av kostnadsfri öppensjukvård. Du erbjuds även kompetensutveckling i olika former som exempelvis nätverk, mentor- och adeptsprogram samt ledarutbildning.
   

  

 Vi sitter i ljusa fina lokaler på Lindhagensgatan 98. Hit tar du dig enkelt med kollektivtrafiken.
   

  

 Här kan du läsa mer om förmånerna i vårt kollektivavtal.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Låter det här som något för dig ser vi gärna att du söker så snart som möjligt. För en komplett ansökan räcker det med att bifoga ditt CV. När du ansöker kommer du att få besvara ett antal frågor, dessa ersätter personligt brev.
   

  

 Har du några frågor är du varmt välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef, Andreas Sundberg, andreas.e.sundberg@regionstockholm.se, mobil: 070 264 6063.
   

  

**Om rekryteringprocessen**
 Inom ramen för rekryteringsprocessen kan det bli aktuellt att du utför tester. Det sker digitalt och länken skickas till dig och du får sedan tre arbetsdagar på dig att genomföra testerna.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Hälso- och sjukvårdsförvaltningen stödjer Region Stockholms politiska organisation för att invånarna i Stockholms län har tillgång till en god och säker hälso- och sjukvård samt tandvård. Det innebär att förvaltningen beställer och följer upp hälso- och sjukvård och tandvård för 75 miljarder kronor årligen. Förvaltningen ansvarar också för kunskapsstyrningsorganisationen i Region Stockholm, samt en rad funktioner som är avgörande för hälso- och sjukvårdssystemet, såsom smittskydd, vårdhygien. Läs mer här
   

  

 Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen. Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm
